Reviews.Title: “Good Location, But”
Reviews.Author: mrfoxwoods
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Ki for 3 days. It has a great location, less than 4 minutes to the Trevi Fountain, and lest than 10 to the Spanish Steps. The hotel has no elevator. Front Desk personnel are available, at most, 7 hrs a day. Breakfast is typical Italian but the Breakfast lady is kind and helpful. The 2 rooms we had were rather small but clean. However the shower stall, no tub, had mold in many places. You obviously pay for the location as the room is not worth the price. Most of the furnishings in the room are so old, they should be tossed. At Best this is a 2 star hotel. Those on trip advisor who rated it as a 4-5 star hotel are delusional. this place needs a bulldozer but the location is prime. We would never stay there again..At check in they give you 3 keys. One for the door on the street, one for the door to your hall and one to your room. This certainly suggests that front test personnel are not available some of the day and all of the night. If you need a cab on the day you check out, you better have them call it in the day before because if you leave early, they wont be there to call the morning you leave. If you leave your screen less window open at night, you can hear the cars swish by in the adjacent tunnel... and bugs fly in

Reviews.Title: “Warmly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Hegedus_Zs
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the hotel and we were fully satisfied with everything. It is situated in the heart of Rome, close to the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. There are many good restaurants nearby. It is just a few metres from Barberini metro station. Our room was on the 3rd floor, which was quiet and well-furnished. There are free wifi and PC access. The breakfast was abundant and the coffee was tasty. The staff - Palmira and Diogo - , is truly great, very friendly and always willing to help. It's an excellent starting point to those who want to discover this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: orendman
Reviews.Content: just 2 minutes from trevi fountain and barberrini metro station. the colleseum is about 20 minutes by foot for those who like to walk, and you can use the metro ofcourse. Diogo, who stands at the reception office, is a very nice guy, and he helped us with great tips about where to eat and attractions at the area. there was a computer on each floor with internet, but the wi-fi signal in the rooms was unstable. we came late at night, after informing the hotel about that, but found the hotel closed. luckly for us we booked a pick up from the airport and the driver helped us get to a sister hotel nearby where we took the keys, and then he drove us back. to conclude, we had a nice time at a good place, but it is very important to inform people well ahead about what they are to expect if coming late.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JJS856
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated within walking distance to all the main attractions Rome has to offer (five minute walk to the Trevi), as well as close to a Metro station (less than five minute walk). Diogo, the hotel manager, is full of information and helpful advice. He will set up taxi service to and from the hotel if you contact him prior to your stay. The other staff is also very friendly and welcoming. We felt like we were staying with family. Breakfast is not huge, but tasteful and sufficient. The coffee and cappuccinos are delicious and not to be missed. It is not the most luxurious or newest hotel. There are quirky things that may arise from this, such as spotty water temperature or a toilet that takes a moment to reset or a weak wifi signal, but all in all, we had an incredible stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: Carmeng797
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a small one but is in the hurt of the city and you don;t need bus or metro to visit rome.I stand 3 nights in the first floor is an quiet one,the breakvest is served on the second floor and it s a buffet with a great coffe and cappuccino,croisants,ham,nutella,milk,cereales.The lady which serves is very very nice.In the last evening we had a problem with hot wather it was a tehnical problem. I think I will return in Rome in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected...but ok”
Reviews.Author: emgi99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over a weekend. I chose this hotel for location, cost and based on the very good reviews on tripadvisor. We caught the bus from FCO airport, cost 6 Euros each (usually 4 but the bus was just leaving so we paid the extra). From Termini station it was about a 20 minute walk to the hotel. Ok if you have light luggage or a bag with sturdy wheels! On arrival we were offered the sister hotel for one night as they had oversold. We declined as we were only staying 3 nights and didn't want to swap hotel mid-stay. I'm guessing a later arriving guest didn't get a choice. We were then given room 204. It was tiny! The window only opened onto the stairwell so the room was dark. Bed okay but with the flattest pillows I've ever seen. Unfortunately we also had a very noisy family staying next door and the walls were thin enough to hear every loudly spoken word. Bathroom also tiny but adequate. Room overall okay as we didn't spend much time in it anyway. Breakfast was simple but good - croissants, rolls, ham and coffee. Not enough tables if everyone comes down for breakfast at the same time so there was some hanging around one morning. The hotel is in a great location - 5 minutes to the Trevi Fountain and about 20mins to the Pantheon. There's a stop for the sightseeing buses about 5 minutes away which we used to get to the Vatican and back to Termini at the end of our stay. Loads of restaurants closeby so the hotel has a good location for resting feet and changing before embarking out for the evening. The Despar (Spar) is across the street - very handy for a pre-dinner beer as the cost of beer in the Rome bars and restaurants is prohibitive (6 Euros, compared to 1.59 in the Spar!) Overall maybe we were given the smallest, darkest room in the hotel. For location it was great, cost was competitive but on the basis of our experience I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced gem with a fabulous location & Staff.”
Reviews.Author: mikhel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay at Residenza Ki and can't recommend it warmly enough. The Hotel is in a fabulous location perfectly placed for walking to most of the major tourist attractions. We were astonished to be this close to the Trevi fountain for such a reasonable price. Rooms are of a good size, extremely clean (cleaned every day) and very comfortable. Breakfast featured pastries and the usual continental fare accompanied by juice and a good selection of hot drinks. Rooms feature flat screen TV's (some with English satellite channels) and the complimentary wi-fi has a strong signal. There are also a couple of free internet access points available for those without netbooks. What impressed us most about the Ki was the friendliness and enthusiasm of the staff. Diogo, the manager, provided friendly advice, useful information and was happy to arrange museum tickets and restaurant reservations. When we experienced a problem with our bathroom he sorted things out quickly and with the least possible fuss. Other members of staff were similarly friendly and happy to help. The only problem that we could see with the hotel was that its lack of a lift and multiple flights of stairs probably make it unsuitable for those with mobility problems. After a long days sight-seeing the stairs can be a bit daunting even to the more agile. In all other respects the Ki was a first class experience at great price. We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location for good price”
Reviews.Author: brillwhensober
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Rome with my fiancee for the Six Nations match against Italy. We arrived late at night and, as per other reviews, it is a bit of hassle to get the keys if your taxi driver doesnt speak English (!), but it is definitely worth it. The room we had was on the 3rd floor and was very clean and big by Rome standards. The bathroom was lovely. The room was cleaned everyday. Breakfast is basic but is just what is needed before taking to the streets. Make sure you have a chat to Diogo on the front desk even if you have been to Rome before as his restaurant recommendations proved to be brilliant! Location wise, this place wont be beaten, it is within spitting distance of the Trevi fountain and you can walk to all other attractions very easily. All in all, i would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, price...a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: friends1178
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful holiday, stayed 6 nights at Rezidenza Ki Rome during which time it snowed, something very rare for Rome. Diogo (receptionist) was extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay, giving us advice and could not do enough for us. Diogo arranged transport from the airport to the hotel going via the sister hotel to collect our room key as Rezindenza Ki Rome does not have 24hour reception. Our room was located on the first floor which was very clean, fresh sheets everyday and quiet. We found the location to be fantastic and meant we could walk everywhere...even Vatican City only took 20-30 minutes passing by all of the main sights. 100% recommendation and we will be staying here again in the future. Very cheap for a centrally based hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay over a weekend”
Reviews.Author: DanyaV
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel just for a weekend together with my girlfriend. First of all, location is perfect. It's just 2 min walking to Trevi fountain and to Spagna Piazza. Then, staff is very friendly, helpful and really professional. Rooms are nice and clean - ours was located on the third floor and it seems to be new as well as other rooms on this floor. Breakfast are not impressive, but still very decent. Summarizing - this is a perfect place (especially considering price) to stay over a weekend in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ioanna T
Reviews.Content: We had a difficulty in finding it (cause there was no sign and it is in the 1st floor of a building in Via Rasella). Cheap accomodation, clean rooms, relatively quiet, 5' minute walking from Fontana di Trevi! Good hotel for a 3day trip to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: MelandDan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hidden gem in November 2010. The hotel is quite difficult to find as doorway with tanoy only (no obvious signs). The room was on the small side but has all you need for a great trip. Lovely and clean too. The greatest part of this hotel is the location, all the major attractions are within walking distance. Trevi fountain is only 5-7 mins walk. I would certainly stay here again as we have fell in love with Rome.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: Hlsad11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and had the most wonderful stay! The staff are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and the bed comfortable. We stayed in two rooms, one on the same floor as the breakfast room which was reasonable size, a small bathroom but comfortable and clean. We then moved to a room on the next floor (the owner gave us the option if we wished to have a quieter room when it came available) although we never found it loud we moved rooms anyway. It was much bigger and newly renovated! A pleasant suprise! The breakfasts were great! The best Danishes and croissants on our whole trip! Fresh every morning! The coffee is also delicious! We would definitly stay here again. We never used the train to get around as you can walk everywhere. We felt very safe. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: gilda
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 days in this hotel. Really can't add much to the other great reviews. Location, location, location. We would walk for miles, and since the hotel is in the middle of everything, we would go to the hotel and take a 30 minute break and stretch our legs, etc. and then keep going. Also, so clean you could "eat off the floor". We know that this hotel has no lift (elevator) so it's not for those that can't climb. The hotel always smelled great, the bathroom was very modern, and the breakfast was very filling with great cappucino. The star, of course, is Diogo; he truly was wonderful. One of the nights there was a problem with the hot water and this young man didn't stop until the problem was solved. Please note that things like these can happen in any hotel at any time. Also, the hotel is not that hard to find at all and yes, it's at the end of a hill (there are a few of those in Rome, you know) but just take your time climbing. I really recommend this hotel in spite of any other negative reviews. Thank you for reading this review. G.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Valentina K
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from Rome! The Hotel "Residenza" is pretty easy too find it. Before I start my journey I have read from a lot of people that's not easy to locate the hotel. Take the metro, stop at the barberini station go straight then left and at the next road "Via Rasella 53" is your hotel! Simply stupido...lol...anyway...The stuff is excellent very helpful and kind. The Location is perfect, nearby to everything, Trevi Fountain is 2 blocks away, right next to the metro, but I used it only to go to the Vatican everything else was by foot (my legs still hurts)!!! The rooms it's not something amazing but after all you just need a place to sleep. The breakfast is perfect the croissant filled with cream & chocolate, perfect cappuccino and a lot of other foods. The only disadvantage was that in one room the shower had zero pressure with result a we need about 30 mins to take a bath. The other room the air condition wasn't working at all and it was too cold. Everyday there was a maid and she was cleaning the rooms. That's all! I totally recommend this hotel for someone how wants to stay 3 or 4 days in the center of Rome!!!! Have Fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: smon g
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a superb location, the room we had was very spacious and kept clean. The continental breakfast was good and plentiful. the staff are all very friendly and helpful. Diogo (pronounced diego) at reception was very helpful and friendly. this hotel is all about it's location. 5mins to the trevi fountain, 10mins to the Spanish steps, 20mins to the coloseum & 30>40mins to the Vatican. thats going at my wifes slooooow walking pace

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but careful of the stairs”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTeacher
Reviews.Content: This lovely little place is more like an apartment than a hotel. Our room had a double bed and a single bed and was more than enough for the three nights we spent there. It had air conditioning (a must for Rome in the summer) and was clean and comfortable. The staff were charming and very helpful, and always able to advise on restaurants, directions and places to go. It's only a short walk from the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain and we used this hotel as a base for walking to all of Rome's sights. It's hidden away so it's slightly difficult to find at first but it's on a very quiet road so no traffic noise to worry about. There's no lift so carrying luggage up the stairs could be a challenge if you weren't fit and healthy! Although I'm sure they would help if required. All in all an ideal place to stay for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: Cathrine S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Ki for 3 nights. Even from the day we booked a room we were taken care of. A nice e-mail from the hotel came shortly after reservation. They offered to arrange a pick-up service for us at the airport. Not only to avoid lose valuable time, but also because they said it is nice knowing there are someone waiting for you. And that is so true! The room was not big, but we had everything we needed: Bed, bathroom, shower, fridge, free Wi-Fi, and airconditioner. Just perfect! And: We arrived before the check-in time, but they were aware of that and had our room ready. The breakfast was really good, and the coffee...Mmmmm! The location could not be any better. Simply the best. But when all this is said I would like to say something about the man at the reception, in our case: Diego. If you are the next one to be one of his guests, you are just so lucky! I have never felt so good taken care of at a hotel before. You just got to like this guy! So all in all I can and I will recommend this hotel with my whole heart.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in the heart of Rome and is looking for a clean and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ZR123154913
Reviews.Content: Although doesn't have an elevator, if you can manage stairs, help is available with luggage. Refurbished rooms are tastefully decorated. Staff is helpful and friendly. Plenty of hot water when we needed it. Air-conditioning worked well. Older building with character. We got there after reception closed but they kept it open for us as we were delayed. Internet on every floor and good security. Right in the heart of Rome, so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Darren B
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed four nights at the Residenza Ki in Rome and we were very happy with our choice. The room and the hotel were clean, there was free Internet and the breakfast in the mornings, although small, was very nice. The staff really made our stay even more incredible. The servers in the breakfast room made a fantastic cappucino and were very friendly each morning. Alessandro at the front desk offered us useful tourist information each day and allowed us to use his work computer to print off details of our trip. He was truly an amazing host and was incredibly friendly to us throughout our entire stay. He also kept our valuables safe in a lock box because there are no safes in the rooms. I can't say enough good things about Alessandro, especially after he left us with a bottle of Champagne in our room on our last night! I am convinced you won't find hospitality and service like this at any other Bed and Breakfast in Rome for the same price as the Residenza Ki. The hotel was quite and in a great location. The room was a good size and well air-conditioned. I would reccomend a room on the third floor so that you are not woken up by people eating breakfast in the morning. The hot water in the shower was a bit of an issue, but it does eventually heat up, although there isn't much pressure. This was the only issue we had during our entire stay and was nothing more than a minor inconvenience. This hotel is GREAT value for money and has incredibly friendly staff. I would reccomend the Residenza Ki in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Gianluca6969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residenza Ki for two nights. We enjoyed our stay. Location was perfect, walking distance from the main attraction of Rome! We rented a "motorino" just because we were so tired of walking around but we definitely didn't need it! We stayed on the 3d floor and rooms were very clean and very silent. Service was great especially breakfast! We loved Ms Palmira cappuccino and croissants were superb! Definitely a great deal for the price and location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte P
Reviews.Content: This bed and breakfast is in the perfect location to explore Rome. It is a short walk to the Trevi fountain and all of the main sites are walking distance, even the Vatican. Our room was a good size and the bathroom was clean with a good shower. The breakfast was nice with a selection of cereals and pastries and frshly made coffees. This isn't a fancy place, but it had eveything we needed as you do not spend much time at the hotel. The owner is very friendly and helpful and speaks excellent english.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Scotty118
Reviews.Content: I booked last minute to visit Rome with a friend. He had already booked to stay here. We had to share a double as there were no room available, but that was no problem. Its only a place to stay and as long as its clean and friendly, what more could you want? Very friendly staff, Diogo was very helpful with advice ever time we asked about something. Nice breakfast in morning and good coffee. Really handy for getting around -- as everyone has said its an easy walk to the Trevi Fountain (great place to have an ice cream before going back to the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: eskimodave
Reviews.Content: Located ten minutes walk from the Trevi fountain, this place had clean rooms and friendly staff. Look out for the big green door, as there's no indication on the front that it's a hotel. Nice breakfast in the mornings, and easy walk to the tourist buses and metro station. Rooms were rather dark and didn't have many facilities. For the price you could probably find something nicer nearby

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina K
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed here for 4 nights while traveling through Rome. We have nothing but good things to say about this hotel! Great value for the room and location. You are close to a few attractions and the metro is easily accessible. The staff here is incredibly friendly and very helpful. Our room was clean and recently remodeled. After reading other peoples reviews where they are complaining about room size, stairs you have to walk up, A/C, etc… They should probably not be traveling Europe or go find a Four Seasons if you are going to complain about these petty things. I would recommend this hotel to someone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I wouldn't have stayed here”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoGina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 15-17. Unfortunately it wasn't the greatest experience. To begin with, we booked a driver through the hotel to pick us up from the airport. Fortunately I printed the email the hotel sent me with the rate, because the driver wanted 10Euros more and argued with us. Apparently our rate was negotiated through the hotel and he wasn't aware of it. Also this hotel is in an apartment complex-something I wasn't aware of, so it didn't even look like a hotel. When the driver dropped us off out front and left, we had no idea where to go or what to do. We were relieved when Diego from the front desk cleared things up with the driver and then directed us into the hotel (apartment). Unfortunately there is no elevator so lugging our bags up three flights of stairs was no fun. Finally although Diego was very helpful regarding directions around Rome, the air in our room wasn't working-we told him about it but it never got fixed. All in all, terrible location, no elevator and no air. Not the quaint, airconditioned hotel it described itself as.

Reviews.Title: “Great! :D”
Reviews.Author: simenknudsen
Reviews.Content: Well, I see people saying this is a bad place. we got the message this was an bed and breakfast. And it was Great!! Okey they do not have a big sign, but if you ask the cab driver, he pointed it out! The reseption guy, was extrimly nice and helpful! room was great, shower okay. I work in the navy in norwayand have to say i coming back. To everybody saing this is a bad place, well take a 4 star hotel. dont expect it from an B&B. This is a exelent stay 4 min walk from fontana di Trevi!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience - please choose somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Aud1230
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for several nights and encountered several problems: 1. We arrived on the road, and the taxi driver dropped us off on the road and we couldn't find our hotel anywhere. We wandered down the road with our bags before figuring out that it was not labeled at all. There is no sign. 2. On the hotel's website, it says that reception is open until 10pm. We arrived at 8:30, and found a note taped to the unlabeled door that is outside that hotel that said "As you can tell from our website, reception closes at 8:00pm every night". They told us to follow the attached map to a sister hotel that was a 10 minute walk a way. They did not attach a map, so we were left in Rome, with our bags, at 8:30pm with no map. Also, when we figured out where it was, it was more like a 25 minute walk away, not 10 minutes. This was completely unacceptable. ***On a side note, the next night we came back to the hotel at 6:15 at night and saw a note taped to the door for another person that said "As you can tell from our website, reception closes at 6:00pm every night". However, whoever this was intended for did have a map attached. 3. I've stayed in a lot of budget accommodations. This hotel, while clean, had the worst bed I have ever slept on. It was similar to sleeping on a rough futon and I actually hurt all night while sleeping on it. It was awful. 4. The air conditioner worked, and was lovely. 5. For the 4 days we were there, we only had hot water 1 time. It was terrible, and nothing was done to fix it. It seems to be a problem over the past few months. 6. Our room, and another room, was actually IN the breakfast room. Our door was literally 6 inches away from the loud juice machine. This means that we were woken up every morning by lots of noise when breakfast was being set up (at about 6:30 am). Overall, this was an awful place to stay. It is in a good location, it is clean, but other than that I would not recommend staying there. We definitely wasted our money on this one!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Nando738
Reviews.Content: You start your trip by barely stumbling on the place because there is nothing resembling a sign or name. Then, you must walk up four flights, with luggage, to your room. We must say the room was extremely clean and the bathroom was nice. However, the shower was absolutely miserable. My husband and I have traveled Europe quite a bit so we are aware of the differences in accommodations (most often showers) but this was beyond ridiculous. The water literally trickles out and it switches from hot to cold. Location is decent as it is in walkable distance to most attractions (Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps). With all the competition, you can definitely do better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: Audra81
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Ki is a great hotel near the Trevi Fountain. Diego, the desk manager for the three nights we were there, was great. The rooms had amazing air conditioning and excellent wi-fi, and the breakfast was a wonderful value. It's not perfect - the shower head didn't always stay on for us, and the plug in the bathroom did not work, but overall, this is an excellent hotel in a great location. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: amess002
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever. (And we loved all of our hotels during our Italy trip, and we stayed at mainly 1 and 2 star hotels.) Other than nuisances you can expect from most Italian hotels (no elevator and hotel not on first floor, queen bed is just two cots pushed together, TV has no English channels, strange location up a very steep street), there were two minor problems and two major problems that made this hotel a uniquely awful experience. Minor problems (frustrating but you can deal with them): *Air conditioning didn't work *Arrive past 4pm (when their concierge desk closes) and you'll need to walk 10 minutes with your luggage (mainly uphill) to their sister hotel, Saturnia. They'll give you your key, and then you're told to walk back another 10 minutes to Residenza Ki. (This happened to us, and, while apparently it's on their hotel's website, we were caught surprised because we booked through a third-party website as most international travelers do, and that website didn't mention this bit of information.) Major problems (main reasons not to stay here): *Building door lock jams randomly and can only be opened from inside *No 24 hour concierge desk (closes at 4pm) Because we dropped off our bags in our room and went out to dinner, it wasn't until around 9pm that we came back to the hotel and discovered the building's outside door was jammed. The Residenza Ki's concierge desk had closed at 4pm, but we were told (in perfect english) by their sister hotel Saturnia that we could call them at any time of night. So we called Saturnia about the door jam at the Residenza Ki, but no one there speaks english at night! Even better, when we got an Italian speaker from a local restaurant to translate for us, we were told by Saturnia they couldn't do anything right now!!! We had our bags locked upstairs in our hotel room, and we had to fly back home the next morning! While we waited over the next three hours, 8 other people staying at the Residenza Ki tried to get in with their keys and couldn't. We finally got inside around midnight only because one of the couples waiting with us had a sister in a hotel room taking a shower; we had to go down a dark alley behind the building, climb a grate, pound on her window, and finally she came downstairs and let us in. By the way, once we got inside, the front door lock didn't have any obvious problems with it, which suggests their building's front door lock is generally faulty and can jam on any hotel guest at any moment. Long story short, most Italian hotels (including the 1 star hotels) have 24 hour concierge, so why pick one of the few places without it? It was really the source of all our problems: we had to walk an extra 20 minutes with luggage to get our hotel key, we couldn't switch rooms when our AC wasn't working, we had no one to turn to when their buiding door lock jammed. It seems like a small insignificant thing if everything goes right, but a 24 hour concierge desk can be a lifesaver!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Emma496
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute and had little expectation of the room, but the location was perfect so booked any way. Before even leaving to go to Rome within a few hours of booking we received an e mail from hotel with very helpful info and directions to sister hotel where we had to pick up keys. On arrival on a very hot day we had to make our way to sister hotel, as we were late arriving. (1930 hours) directions were good and took ten minute walk from train station. The stressful bit was finding our hotel and ended up getting taxi as we had, had enough by then. The room it's self was very large clean and a brilliant surprise aircon was awsome and really essential in the heat. Bathroom small but spotless breakfast good and staff very helpful would definatley recommend to friends and would stay again no problem

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Personalized Experience”
Reviews.Author: sdandashy
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Residenza Ki. Diego greeted us with such hospitality. He took his time in showing us where to go and what to do. Even was able to find us a tux rental place last minute for an event we were going to. Be advised, the style of the hotel can be best described as part of an apartment building, where they own several floors. Each floor has several rooms off of a main central room which has a computer for your disposal (very convenient!! a nice surprise!). The rooms are smaller, but as to be expected for any city hotel. It has recently been renovated which is great! The bathrooms are really nice. Only caveat, the water pressure in the shower is not so great. Otherwise, it's really really nice. Oh and the AC is really great! Perfect to save you from the summer heat! As it is an apartment style hotel, keep in mind that you will have to walk up a flight of stairs to get to the reception, and an additonal flight to your room. But it's really not bad at all. The location is SUPERB! We came from FCO on the train to the Termini, then took the subway to Barberini. It's three blocks form the subway, which is great if you a traveling on a budget. Now as for location to sights, it's super close to the Fontana di Trevi. Walking is great in Rome as you can get to so many places in 5, 10, 20 minute walks. It's certainly safe and clean for a big city, plus you get to take in so much! It's also close to the Spanish Steps and the shopping on Via Del Corso. We even checked out the Villa Borghese, which is also a close walk. For the price, it is totally worth it! We loved, loved, loved our stay there! Just keep in mind that it's not the type of place with a grand foyer, but it's such a personalized experience. You feel like you've got your own awesome apartment in ROME! I highly recommend it! ***Side note: Be sure to buy a Roma Pass. It's 25 euro and admission is included to TWO sites, then discounted admission to places you visit after. I highly suggest you use it for the Colliseum. You get the breeze by the 1 -2 hour line of people waiting to get in. SOOOO worth it! Also you get ulimitated use of the subway for three days!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic, good location”
Reviews.Author: Stuffy193
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 teenagers) stayed here in late May/early June for 3 nights. I think it is a very nice hotel (more a B&B I guess), very basic and amazing location. We knew we were arriving late so were told to collect our key from their sister hotel, where the nicest man in the world was waiting for us - so helpful, he gave us a map and directions for an amazing place to eat (La Rampa, just down the road), and booked us a free taxi to take us to the hotel! The rooms were basic, just a bed and a tiny bathroom. One of our showers was a bit dodgey, the shower head kept falling off, but to be honest I could live with that for a few nights. The water pressure was also rubbish :S The man at reception was nice and friendly and very helpful, and the breakfast was good - croissants and fruit and eggs, nice orange juice, excellent coffee. At the end of the day, it's the location that sells it - so central! Trevi Fountain literally 30 seconds away, Spanish Steps just round the corner, lots of nice restaurants. If I'm going to be picky, these are the problems: 1. If you sleep with the windows open there is quite a noisy road/underpass nearby, but if you've spent all day walking around Rome that's not going to be enough to keep you up! 2. As I said, rubbish water pressure from the showers. 3. Don't turn up late and don't tell them because you'll be locked out and confused and have to go to the sister hotel. Just be organised and everything works out fine! And you get to meet the lovely man at the reception in the sister hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, confortable , very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Carol024
Reviews.Content: Good and simple hotel, located near Fontanna di Trevi and Via Veneto, nice staff. Clean and confortable, close to subway and major attractions. Generous breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Geat Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tlong60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residenza Ki for two nights in May. The hotel has clean and spacious rooms and the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: rd431982
Reviews.Content: The Manager, Diogo, was everything we expect from someone in the tourist industry - polite, helpful, friendly and courteous. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is perfectly situated and we were able to reach the main tourist areas on foot. The rooms on the top floor had recently been redecorated and the bathrooms were shiny and new, the bed sheets were crisp and white and the bathroom towels were fluffy.Breakfast was plentiful. We would unhesitatingly recommend this hotel for anyone who does not have a problem with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing: Rome is a fantastic city but book something better than this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jeffacake
Reviews.Content: My husband booked us a trip to Rome for my 30th birthday, which we were both very excited about. However, on arriving at Residenza Ki we were informed that a water problem on the first floor made our room uninhabitable for the weekend. Diago who greeted us at reception was pleasant enough and very apologetic. He explained that the hotel is old and that it's difficult to maintain. We've since seen a review on TripAdvisor that suggests that they may simply have overbooked... your guess is as good as mine. He put us in a taxi (which he paid for) back in the direction we'd just walked from to the 'sister' hotel - Hotel Saturna - which we were told was compariable. I have no idea if it the Saturna really is a compariable hotel because I didn't get to see what the inside of a room at Residenza Ki was really like. However, the Saturna was horrible. The room was small, it smelt of cheap air freshener, the bed was at an angle so your head was below your feet, the lights didn't all work so the room was dingy, the sheets has suspicious stains on them; the bathroom was tiny, mouldy and claustrophobic. There was also a pointless LCD tv that you couldn't actually see unless you would stood in the opposite corner of the room because of the angle it was sellotaped on to its stand at. Breakfast was adequate, but some of the offerings were stale. The staff, though pleasant, were a bit disorganised and sent us off in the wrong direction to buy opera tickets. Ultimately though, all of this would have been water off a ducks back as we've stayed in worse places as backpackers. But on this occassion we were not backpackers, we were away celebrating and although not expecting 5* luxury niether hotel was really up to the standards they advertise themselves at. Good points were, the location of both hotels. Residenza Ki is right by the Trevi fountain and the Saturna although near the Termini is also right by the Colleseum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel . Very well located. Very nice people! Really good stay”
Reviews.Author: 187147Hello
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel . Very well located. Very nice people! Really good stay. We spent 4 wonderful days there! Coming back as soon as possible! Elisabeth

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, friendly and clean, and in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bracken25
Reviews.Content: When we arrived I was a little concerned as it was just a door in a back street, but when we went up the stairs I was very pleased it was clean , friendly and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ceclemmens
Reviews.Content: Travelled with two grown-up offspring. This hotel ticked all the boxes. Diego greeted us with a sightseeing map and info about local restaurants. Excellent location. Less than 5 min to Trevie Fountain and a little more to Spanish Steps. An ideal hotel for walking to most of Romes historic sights. Delighted to find that Rome is mainly flat. I have MS and my mobility is restricted and walk with a stick but managed with frequent stops. Would definately stay again. Will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “exellent location lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: bestravel2011
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service, professional staff!!!!!Our room was cosy but with a lovely huge bed which was very comfortable. Everywhere was very clean and well tended. All the staff were very friendly and helpful with questions about the city. I would most certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome as the location is perfect for walking to all the sights and to the bars and restaurants in the evenings. All in all a very pleasant stay in a lovely city.Special thanks to Diogo!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and set up for our high school girls group from U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Abelian
Reviews.Content: Two chaperone couples traveling with 14 high school girls from the U.S to visit Rome on the way to a conference in Genoa. We took advantage of two quads and two triple rooms as well as two doubles. Worked out great on the same floor with the breakfast room between the rooms. Rooms were adequate for our group even if there was a little shower overflow in one room as described by another traveler. Our plane was also late to Rome and the staff rearranged the service to pick up our group 7 hours later. We walked everywhere easily and took the metro to the Vatican and then to the Termini station to go to Florence. The desk staff also had the maid come early for breakfast for us and served all 18 of us in good time so we could get to the Vatican early. Overall good place to stay with a group and great service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: SianM75
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecing much from this hotel given the mixed reviews but I was pleasently suprised. Informing the hotel that I would not be able to make the standard check-in time, the hotel e-mailed me directions to the alternative hotel to pick-up the keys from. Slightly disconcerting that the person at this propoerty did not ask to see my confirmation but it was easy to find and then go onto the Residenza Ki. The rooms could be cleaner (the floor didn't seem to be cleaned) but the rooms are good with toiletries, haridryer and SKY TV. The air conditioning didn' t work too well but we didn't need it. Our room was in the breakfast area but we didn't get disturbed by this - if we had slept in late in the mornings it may have affected us more but my travelling companion was a very early riser!! The location of this property is perfect - 3 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and is on a quiet side street. There is a small Spar at the end of the road plus an English pub and lots of lovely local restaurants in the area. Don't be swayed by reviews about the area, if you are street-smart you should have no concerns about the neighbourhood. I would recommend this property if you are looking for a basic hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect and great price!”
Reviews.Author: MSP_one
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a group of friends and booked the quad room which was very spacey. The location couldn't of been better. Spent hours exploring the city on foot and this was the perfect spot to stay right near Trevi!! The manager was very helpful and nice. Definitely way better than the hotel near the train station that I stayed at on my first trip to Rome. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but disappointment”
Reviews.Author: gatormom79
Reviews.Content: Here is an honest review of this place. It seems it is being renovated, however, the room we got had mold on about a third of the walls in the bathroom. I was going to post pictures, but there is no need. I checked another room in this place and it was nicer than the one we were given and since people were moving furniture into the hotel, it leads me to believe it was being renovated. The double room, which we were given, is not for families unless you have teenagers or the room is for 4 grown adults. Everyone is nice, but if you need any assistance, it will be hard because they leave the desk at around 3:30 every day and then, it's like you are in an apartment building. If you need anything, you are on your own. Another suggestion...If you are planning to stay in a place like this during any holiday in Rome, they will not be around, and if they are, it will be hard to get them. Word of advice: Do not stay here with young children. It is perfect for a young couple or college kids. Comfort and Cleanliness: The mattresses are pretty thin compared to other European hotels. The window wouldn't close, which is, according to the manager, is "illegal in rome". After our complaint, we got a promise that it would be fixed so we could get a good night sleep, and still no repair. The street that this hotel is on is busy so it's noisy at night. We also had an issue with our shower. It wouldn't drain and when we complained about it, it, too, never got fixed. We just moved to another hotel because taking showers 6 inches deep in water was not fun. The rooms are clean, but because of the mold, couldn't give them an excellent. Location: The location is wonderful. This is the reason why we picked this "hotel". It is right down the street from the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. Also, a grocery store is only a stone thrown away. There are other hotels in the vicinity that are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: jbell_79
Reviews.Content: We selected Resedenza Ki because of its location. Right near the Trevi Fountain, and within half an hours walk are all the big tourist spots- Vatican City, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Tratsevere... etc. We were told by reception that there were public transport links very close by to all these places, but obviously the walk is well worth it to see so much more. To put in a negative spin, the only 'problem' we had was the thinness of the walls. There are only a small amount of rooms, and you can hear whatever is going on in each room, very clearly. It really wasn't a problem to us, but it was to some. We took the advice from someone elses review and asked for a room on the first floor. Otherwise, the rooms open straight onto the breakfast area. Rooms and bathroom were clean. A small room, but thats to be expected in the area and is was very nicely presented- simple but attractive and it had everything we needed. We had breakfast on the first 2 days, but then skipped it, preferring to eat out. It was a decent breakfast though- cereal, breads, cheese and meats, croissants. Due to location, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent budget accommodation. Total money worth!”
Reviews.Author: SundeepMithran
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a pleasure to stay in. the rooms were neat and tidy and is located 5 mins from a metro. So you can travel to anywhere in rome easily. Even the vatican is only a few metro stations away. Also, the gentle man at the reception is helpful and will tell you how to get around and plan your day. However they will try to coax you into a cab to the airport when you leave, its just way cheaper to take the metro. If you are looking for a neat budget hotel thats easily connected to the rest of rome by metro then this is highly recommended. Be warned though: the hotel is not easy to find.there are no hotel boards or signs. Take a print out of the google maps blown to maximum zoom in, and have the hotels number handy. Otherwise, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for, cheap and cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: Receptionist_11
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the gentleman behind recption was very polite and helpfull and talked us through the area and how to reach all the tourist hot spots etc. However the bedroom was not up to scratch. As I myself work within a Hotel i was disgusted to see the poor hygine standards in the bedrooms, unfortunately i did not get any photos but there was a very large patch of mold within the shower cubicle and our bed was held together with celotape! not so handy when you have a partner weighing over 13 stone!! the bedroom was small but perfectly adequate and did provide a television etc, Very Basic. The location however is GREAT! 200m if that from the trevi fountain, right in the middle of the hussle and bustle of rome allthough there is a very noisy tunnel right next to the hotel which kept me up at night a bit. Food: Basic! Breakfast very very simple, coffe and a small pastry at a stretch. All in all i would say great for young couples such as ourselves and people on a tight budget but if you can afford to stretch a bit id chose elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: nielmala
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel approximately six weeks prior to my visit after reading the reviews. It was a little difficult to find, but that was partially my maps fault. The sign is very subtle and easily missed. Francesco was very nice, but thank goodness he was there... His hours are 9 ish to 5ish, and not on Mondays. My full payment was requested up front, I guess since their office hours are so sparse. Breakfast was supposed to start at 0730. The first day, the lady didn't arrive until after 0830 and there was watered down juice from concentrate, hard bread and white American cheese in wrappers. Coffee was denied to guests. The second and third day, I opted to not even attempt breakfast since it was again running late both days. There was plenty of hot water after you let it run for like 10 min but the sink and shower did not drain well. I knew it would be a basic b&b, but the breakfast was ridiculous and the lack of staff attendance was notable. The only good thing was the location and vicinity to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Feel a little duped by all the positive TripAdvisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: scasiello
Reviews.Content: This was my family's first time in Europe. All the other hotels we had stayed in throughout our vacation, London, Florence, Reggalo, had been recommended to us by friends. The Residenza Ki was the only location we had to scout out on our own. We read through several reviews on TripAdvisor prior to booking. The Residenza Ki had very positive, in fact glowing reviews. When we got there, around 1:30pm in the afternoon, we had to climb 3 floors to finally find someone to help us, because the front desk is not "manned" on Mondays. We got our room. It was dingy, dark and cramped. It was my husband, my 10-year old son and myself. The room was supposed to be a triple but really it was a double with a sub par rollaway bed against one wall. There was barely room to walk between the armoire, the 2 beds and the wall. Our room was right outside the small checkin desk so we heard with some clarity every conversation that took place at the front desk. The front desk gentlemen were very nice and even arranged our ride to the airport. Upon our leaving, they offered a future discount if we went online and wrote a positive review. Perhaps this is the reason for all the "great" reviews we had seen. I don't know. It was the most expensive place we stayed the entire time we were in Europe and the worst quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected... and more”
Reviews.Author: molley_pop
Reviews.Content: It was everything we expected... the perfect location. The hotel is in a central area to EVERYTHING!!! We could walk anywhere (and did) in the city within 20 to 30 minutes. Before going to Rome I was very skeptical of the hotel. Originally when we booked it, it had many great reviews, but the month before we left the reviews were more concerning (ie. some say there is mold in the bathroom and the service is terrible). We actually got a great reception and introduction to the city by the front desk staff (he gave the best recommendations on where to eat). The first night we were upgraded to the hotel next door because the hotel was "under renovation", which may have been an overbooking; however, when we finally got to stay in our hotel it was perfect... for what we needed. It provided us a place to stay in the perfect location, we did not need a fancy room since we ARE in ROME and aren't spending a lot of time in the room. However, previous reviews made the rooms sound terrible... but it also seems as though these people may have been expecting too much. Anyway, it was perfect for us, and if you need a room (which was a decent size) in a central location and you want a great staff I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mira_savic
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, close to all of the main sites. Staff were very helpful. Would definitely stay at Residenza Ki again.

Reviews.Title: “Try elsewhere.....”
Reviews.Author: Jmay
Reviews.Content: Firstly we had to haul our cases up 2 flights of stairs just to check in. Then another 2 flights to get to our room. The guy at check-in was very helpful however he was only working the day we arrived. (reception is only open 8ish - 5) The remainder of the days we got the impression it was the owner, who was quite abrupt, especially when he wasn't busy! We were given a room through the breakfast room and were woken on the 3 mornings we were there by the lady who set the tables etc banging dishes from 6.30 on. We had a large enough room but the bathroom was tiny, particularly the shower - hard to wash your hair without banging your elbows off the wall or the shower door!! On reflection we would have been better paying a bit extra for better facilities.... thankfully we only had 3 days here but it was more than enough.... When on reception the owner spent most of the time trying to persuade people to get taxis to the airport that he would arrange with a particular driver - you paid the owner! When we did ask him to arrange a taxi for 4 of us plus cases which we'd left with him on our last day, he got us probably the smallest taxi in the whole of Rome!!!! Funny now but it wouldn't have been if we'd been in a rush. The taxi driver wasn't pleased that the person booking the taxi hadn't said about the number of people and the luggage so that a bigger car would be sent. Needless to say we know it was because the owner had wanted us to take his taxi to the airport and wouldn't listen when we explained we were going to Florence, via train and not the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, in a very friendly and clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TheRiklyns
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the most enjoyable week in the Hotel Residenza Ki. The location is fantastic, only 2 minutes walk to Trevi Fountain and most other attractions are very easy to walk to. The staff, Francesco and Diego were very friendly and most helpful. They offered great tips for sight seeing and restaurants. The rooms are very clean and the breakfast was good. Be very careful of the taxis from the station though. It is only a 10 minute walk but we were charged $45 Euro, maximum charge should be no more than approx $20Euro. We would highly recommend Residenza Ki, congrats to Franseco and Diego for helping us to have a fabulous Roma Experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: polperro
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay. The hotel is in a brilliant location just minutes way from the trevi and spanish steps, all the other sights apart from the vatican are within a 30 minute walk away Breakfast was great for a free one and the lady who does it could not do enough for you. The only downside was the room we had a twin (room 204), it had no window and was tiny although very clean, we asked to be moved the day of arrival when finally someone who spoke english turned up on reception we were advised we could be moved but not until the next day. Due to a hectic scheule of tours already pre booked this was not going to be possible so we decided just to stay there and put up with it. Overall the hotel was very good and as i have said you cannot beat the location but did not like the fact that their was not anyone there all the time. Worried that if for any reason the keys did not work of the three doors you had to get through there was no one there to let you in etc. Would probably stay there again if i was to return to Rome but would specify not in that room.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciate the Value”
Reviews.Author: lfeltus
Reviews.Content: We are value-oriented travelers and felt we got a good value with this hotel. The room was a bit small, but it was clean and had a very comfortable king bed. A smaller bed would have given us more space but considering the small amount of time we spent in the room, I'd rather have the larger bed. The bathroom could have been roomier, but it was clean and, again, it was adequate for the money. We found the staff to be more than accommodating and the breakfast was plentiful. An elevator would have been nice, but not worth an extra $50 or more a day. Besides, exercise is a good thing. The location was quiet, yet very central for walking to the sites, catching the metro or getting to the train station. We truly have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Our treatment at this hotel was very poor and would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: DougandChris
Reviews.Content: We had pre-booked (and pre-paid) our stary at Residenza Ki for four nights at the end of our Italy vacation, mainly due to the location of the hotel near the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. When we arrived we were told that they had made a mistake and overbooked the first two nights and sent us to their "sister" hotel - the Hotel Saturnia, which they told us was a comparable. Far from it, this was a two star hotel closer to the Roma Termini. The only available room for the first night was so small that we could not even open our suitcases on the floor. The window was falling out and the bathroom was ridiculous (to sit on the toilet you had to put your feet in the shower). We complained bitterly and they did move us to a bigger room for the second night and finally back to Residenza Ki for the last two nights. We really felt like we had been scamed but there was little we could do as we prepaid the hotel on Expedia and didn't have any option. I would caution anyone booking this hotel to beware, as we felt that this was probably not the first time they had pulled this on an unsuspecting traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: angusmcwalsh
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I have to say that this was an ideal hotel for us, and in a great location. With the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps minutes away and the rest of the torist attractions a short walk or bus ride away i dont think you could fault the location. The hotel is poorly sign posted and if you dont get transfers from the airport to the hotel door you may miss it. The rooms were samll, however, who stays in their rooms for long periods of time whilst on holiday. If you only want somewhere to get changed and sleep then this would be ideal. Dont expect too much and you wont be dissapointed. Understand what breakfast is on the continent and you will be happy with what you get. Cereals, pastries, biscuits, fruit, meat and cheese is a standard continental breakfast. So i was pleased with breakfast. Probably the only thing i was most dissapointed with was there was no tea or coffee making facillities within the room. I would have liked to make a cup of tea before going out or after an afternoon nap. So overall I was very pleased with our stay at Residenza Ki. Its not a 5 star hotel but it was perfect as a base for our trip. Thanks to the team for looking after us :D

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for one night, but if staying longer, look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JillyConQueso
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this for us for the last night of our trip. After spending a week in Capri we needed to stay in Rome one night before our flight home. The location is amazing, on a side street about a block from the Trevi Fountain. We walked from there to Piazza Navona, St. Peter's, Castel Saint' Angelo and back easily. Finding the place in a cab from the station was difficult as it's on a side street and upstairs in a building. There was no one to check us in and the Italian-speaking housekeeper had us wait in the "lobby" for 25 minutes before a guy called and I spoke with him on the phone. This seemed unnecessary as the housekeeper then just handed us a key to a room that opened into the lobby. Our room was pretty spartan, however the AC worked very well (but was loud) and there was a small mounted flatscreen with lots of US channels. As we left to walk around my boyfriend slipped down the old marble stairs that were covered with cement powder from bags being carried up to the 3rd floor all day. There is no elevator. I believe breakfast is included, but our ride to the airport was before the serving time. The bathroom was tiny but clean and the shower was also very small but had great water pressure. The mattress was uncomfortable. I didn't mind this place since it was for one night, however I won't go back mostly because of the inconvenience during check in, the lack of elevator and the messy construction guys.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: hyperjumpingbeans
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Residenza Ki Rome, the location was great, walking distance to all places of interest. The staff were very friendly and helpfull, Francesco recommended a number of restraunts which were excellent. The rooms were spacious and very clean. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst accomodation experience”
Reviews.Author: xanthia12
Reviews.Content: Arrived here at 8pm after walking right past it initially because it was so poorly signposted and on a quiet street. We found a note telling us that reception is closed, and to go and pick up keys from another hotel more than 1km away. We spent another 45mins hauling our bags around in the dark to pick up the keys. The hotel website clearly states that reception is open until 10pm. We confirmed with the management beforehand our arrival time and they said it would be no problem. The did not even warn us beforehand that they would be closed. During our stay, the manager closed reception early - e.g. 3pm or 6pm. We saw notes to other guests telling them to pick up keys elsewhere. Standard of accomodation is poor. Bathrooms were dingy, with mould in the shower cubicle, and shower drains which overflowed. Beds wereold and soft. Breakfast was substandard with stale croissants and old hard boiled eggs with black looking yolks. After the first day, we opted to have breakfast elsewhere. The only positive aspect about this hotel is the location which is within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps. This was our one regrettable booking out of a 3 week holiday in italy. We couldn't wait to leave Residenza Ki. We recommend against booking here, especially if you plan to arrive in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterforlife
Reviews.Content: i travelled to rome for the first time with my parents who aren't so young anymore. I found this place online and thought it would be ideal. Be warned there are no elevators and two flights of stairs to get to the rooms (no so good travelling with the oldies). Rooms were incredibly small but comfortable and clean. Bathroom impossible to get around in it and the hot water in the shower took several minutes to heat up (not ideal if your in a hurry, you'll be having a cold shower). AC was great and view was fantastic, we looked out in the street. There is a cafe next to hotel that stays open late but the shutters and windows are so thick it blocked out all the noise!! Best part, was the staff Diego is the most helpful and genuine man in Rome, he couldn't do enough to help us, showed us where to go and warned us about tourist traps and scammers. Breakfast was incredibly dull... although it is hard to find breakfast in Rome... they like sweet cakes and things like that. So would be best to eat b/f there. they have cereal and cakes and toast. Location was also a fantastic aspect of staying here. Minutes from Trevi Fountain and bus stops and train station (easiest railway system to work out ever). Although, it is very easy to get lost so always carry a map and a hotel business card in case you loose your way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very friendly service, great room - all in all 10/10”
Reviews.Author: Gracie3055
Reviews.Content: RESIDENZA KI WAS PERFECT FOR OUR STAY IN ROME. The hotel is very central, making access to any part of the city very easy - located just near Fontana di Trevi, everything is within walking distance. When I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by a very friendly guy who gave me a map and showed me all the points of interest in the city which was very helpful. Throughout our stay, all the staff were very kind and helpful which made our stay all the more pleasant. The room was a great size and provided all we needed - we had a private bathroom which was newly built & very clean, a comfortable double bed, air conditioning and a TV with a few English channels. For the very reasonable price we paid, we couldn't have asked for more. RESIDENZA KI COULDN'T HAVE BEEN BETTER FOR THE FEW DAYS WE SPENT IN ROME AND I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE TRAVELLING THERE.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Lollyw81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residenza Ki Rome with 2 friends and for the price that we paid for our holiday, we were definately impressed with our stay. The first thing to mention is that the location is fantastic. Literally across the road from the Trevi Fountain and a further 10 minute walk to the Pantheon. We couldn't have asked for a better location. We were glad that we emailed to confirm our reservation before our arrival, as we were pre warned that we had to collect our keys from their sister hotel, a 10 minute walk away. When directed to our guest house we were told it was the Green door on the street, amongst about 5 other Green doors! The Guest House is not clearly marked !! The room for 3 adults was a Queen sized bed and 2 single which was perfect for us. The room was clean and comfortable but I would say that the air con was a little disappointing. It wasn't particularly powerful and although it was reading 16 degrees (the lowest it will go), it certainly didn't feel very cool, especially in the August heat! The staff are really friendly and as we checked in late, they made an effort to come and say hello and introduce themselves the next day. Reading the previous review I agree that if you're staying on the 2nd floor, be warned that you will receive an early morning wake up when the staff prepare for breakfast - and we stayed at the furthest room from the kitchen! Breakfast was ok for what you paid, although our only complaint would be that on our last morning there was only 1 croissant and a few biscuits left for us to eat. It was perfect for our first morning but they don't seem to replenish the breakfast after each day! Overall we had a fantastic trip to Rome and would certainly stay at the Residenza Ki Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and location!!”
Reviews.Author: becbig
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location next to the trevi fountain, the staff was helpful and friendly and the room was clean and spotless. Breakfast was included which was great to start your day of sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: KevinS20002
Reviews.Content: Room was spartan, but clean. Staff was INCREDIBLY helpful and nice! I'd been initially worried, given some of the reviews online, but it became clear that those reviewers were either very picky or very unrealistic. This hotel is STEPS to the Trevi Fountain, and it's very affordable. I would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but few issues”
Reviews.Author: JPGSunderland
Reviews.Content: Stayed over for a long weekend in August. Firstly this hotel was in an excellent location - situated only 5 mins walk (max) to the trevi fountain. The room was basic but clean which is what we expected. I was however a little disapointed with the Air-Con. This was working as far as i could see however it was of little help. It was set to the lowest temperature but didnt appear to be blowing any cold air. This made the nights sleep very uncomfortable. Breakfast was really nice -exactly what we wanted before a days exploring. My advice would be to ask for a room on floor one as every morning at around 7am the maid woke us up by preapring breakfast in the breakfast area which rooms open onto on the second level. Not a lot of noise but enough to wake you up from a nights sleep (however this was handy on a positive note as we had no alarm). Lastly if you check in late be prepared for a 10min walk to the sister hotel to pick keys up. I did email the hotel stating we were due to arrive late and asked for the sister hotels address to go straight there however heard nothing back. This would have been helpfull and i suggest people email ahead in future to save some time. Overall great basic hotel to explore rome at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay at in Europe”
Reviews.Author: sigaleibo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bed and breakfast hotel the best one we have ever been in! Me and my friends found this place on the internet we arrived to the hotel with very low exceptions but were very supriesd to find a wonderful place with a very nice staff the room was so comfortable and clean we loved it The hotel is located in good Location near to the center . the thing that makes this place most special is the staff that was so very nice to us and took care of our every need was very patient with us and with all the questions and requests that we had. Each morning there is fresh coffee and a very nice breakfast even the lady from the kitchen was so nice!! i have no words to describe the kindness of the staff I definitely Recommend this hotel to young people and also Families!! a big thanks to the guy in the reception name Diego-he is the best!! we will definitely return to this hotel in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dorisblonde
Reviews.Content: I come back from Rome where I spend a wonderfull travel. I will be in a little hotel near trevy fontaine. the breakfast was delicious with many many choice to eat and to drink. My bedroom was clean every day and quiet. the staff was very nice and helpfull with us, the boy always helped us when we want to go in a good restaurant for exemple. if I come back a day I will choose residenza ki of course thanks a lot everybody

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Ki was amazing! My husband and...”
Reviews.Author: Artistsbridge
Reviews.Content: Residenza Ki was amazing! My husband and I stayed here for a week during our honeymoon, and we kept saying how glad we were that we did. The location is very close to the Trevi Fountain and within walking distance to everything else. We only used the metro to go to the Vatican and Termini. There are tons of wonderful restaurants in the area, as well as plenty to see and do. As for the staff, we cannot say enough about them. Deigo was incredibly sweet and helped us with any little thing we needed. He gave great restaurant recommendations and directions. The housekeepers also made breakfast, which was delightful. They even remembered what kind of beverages we liked after one time! We were so pleased with Residenza Ki and will hopefully return some day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: jenn2662
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in residenza ki in June.Confortable room, A/C super ,breakfast in the morning delicius.All staff speak fluently english and are all fantastic persons. About the location i would raccomand this place i never used a pubblic transportation Residenza ki is near trevi fountain and spanish steps. I come back again jenn&rob

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: franknor48
Reviews.Content: nice place where you can spend your holydays.Fantastic staff,excellent aircondition sistem amazing breakfast as location.a special thank to mister diogo & andrea (best cappucino in the area) i will come back in the next few weeks after norway cruise for a couple of days. see you son my friend

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: ricwee
Reviews.Content: Stayed over at Residenza Ki from the 4th July till 6th July, enroute back to Malaysia via Rome. We were already tired by the time we reached Rome, as we were initially at the Amalfi Coast. But Residenza Ki's location made it easy for us to walk about as it is fairly near tourists spot (especially the Trevi Fountain) & also a few minutes away from the nearest Metro Station (Barberini). The room we got was cosy and the washroom was decently clean. We will likely visit Rome again, since this trip was too short, and we would very likely return to Residenza Ki.. Regards, ric wee

Reviews.Title: “An upgraded Hostel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travel_allsn
Reviews.Content: We had two room and like many other reviewers got asked to move to a sister hotel down the street due to booking problems. The bathrooms were not clean but the hotel is decorated nice. I would recommend this hotel to someone who is used to staying in a hostel and would like his/her own room for the night. The price was cheap and the location is great, however it is not a fancy hotel with a lot of frills.

Reviews.Title: “Fit our needs”
Reviews.Author: mari962
Reviews.Content: HI. We were on vacation just this past week- Rome and Venice and stayed in these types of Bed and Breakfasts. We were very pleased. The host let us use his phone and helped us reconfirm our flights. The room, including the bathroom, was very clean. The location was great- we ambled through the streets that led us to the Trevi fountain, one of the high points on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “not a good hotel, but at least its cheap”
Reviews.Author: jeffiner52
Reviews.Content: So the friend we were traveling with was asked to stay in another hotel, because the A/C was broken in some rooms, which wasn't too bad as it was right next door, and nicer than the Ki. After the 1st day, we were asked to move onto the second floor because the A/C was going to be checked to make sure it didn't break, which was a little annoying. Warning: There is no elevator, which is common in a lot of European hotels, be prepared to walk up/down a couple of flights with your luggage. In both rooms, the room and the beds were seemed clean, but the bathrooms were not. Besides being the smallest bathrooms in our 4 hotels in Europe, the showers had mold and rust stains on the walls, which made me feel worse after coming out of the shower. Also, the walls were thin. I usually don't let stuff like this bother me, but when you can hear people turning on and off a light switch from another room, that's bad. We were near the entrance from the stairway and could hear everyone coming in/out at night, which was very annoying. The hotel did have a free breakfast of very standard toast/pastries/coffee type stuff, and was probably around 15-20 min walking from a lot of the sites. And only around 10 min from the Trevi fountain, so there were plenty of shops/restaurants and the area seemed safe. Also, the stops for the hop-on/hop-off buses, as well as the Metro was only around 5 min away at Barberini. The hotel also arranged a taxi to the airport for our group of three at 50 euro, which seemed reasonable as the leonardo express train costs 45 euro for three people. The taxi was on time, comfortable, and got us to the airport without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “feeling like home”
Reviews.Author: jaryeon
Reviews.Content: Two of my friends and I spent 3 days in Rome and actually we chose another hotel to stay. But previous hotel was terrible and we moved to this hotel. The room in residenzakirome was very clean and spacious and it's very close to the Trevi Fountain and very good location to get to lots of sights. The best thing in Residenzakirome was people, they were very kind and tried to give best service to guests.

Reviews.Title: “great location with fair price”
Reviews.Author: grmatanzaas
Reviews.Content: we found a hotel with a great locarion close to the fontana di trevi and the metro station so we were not worryed about public transport even when coming back at night. the room was clean and the breackfast nice. only a detail to improve, we had to pick up the key from another hotel (10 min walking) but last day Francesco allowed us to leave the luggage till 18.00 when we had to leave Rome and this is a good datail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: lhx58
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we stayed in during our trip to Italy. Our room was huge and absolutely spotless. The area is quiet, but if the street gets too loud you can just close the windows and turn on the A/C. Breakfast was outstanding (just don't expect bacon and eggs). Staff was diligent and clearly take pride in their work. Location is good too -- walking distance from the Forum, otherwise 5 mins. from the subway station. If you're looking for a reasonably priced room in Rome where you can get a good night's rest and a solid meal before heading out to see the city, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: lvillegirl
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Residenza Ki for 5 nights in June and had a wonderful time. Its a small hotel - I think only 10 rooms, but the wonderful staff made us feel right at home. Francesco and Andrea were warm, friendly, and very helpful hosts. The hotel is located just a short walk from the Barbarini metro stop, and within easy walking distance to many major sights - especially the Trevi fountain. We loved walking by and stopping for a gelato at the Trevi every night as we returned to the hotel. One suggestion though - the entrance to the hotel is easy to miss. Its a plain green door right next to a little cafe. Look up a photo of it on trip advisor or search for it on street view of Google Maps before you leave so you know what you're looking for. The rooms were simple and clean. We stayed the first three nights on the second floor and came back a few days later to spend our last two nights in a room on the first floor. I think the room on the first floor was a bit larger, but just off the lobby, so not as quiet as the second floor room around afternoon siesta time. Breakfast consisted of pastries, bread, cheese, some sliced meat, hard boiled eggs, cereal, juice/cappuccino/tea. Bigger than the typical European breakfast I think, and nice and fresh. Overall I was very very pleased with our stay and I hope we can return the next time we visit Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Great little budget hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: beznee
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, with a fab location. My partner and I spent 3 days in Rome and we were looking for a budget, basic hotel to serve as our base whilst sightseeing and this was exactly that. Breakfast fine. Spacious, quiet room. About a 2-3 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, very close to almost all sights. Good air conditioning which was so very welcome in the July heat. TV with various English and foreign channels, big wardrobe. Also had fridge in our room with various soft drinks, we drank a few which were replaced the next day and they didn't charge us for them. Good value, clean and comfortable. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: shal84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice little hotel from the 24th-26th of May 2010. It is situated in a great central location for a very reasonable price. The hotel is about 5 minutes away from baberini metro station, 3 minutes to the trevi fountain and about 5 minutes to the spanish steps. It also within reasonable walking distance to most of the other sites as well. The surrounding area has a very lively and safe feel to it. There are many eateries and shops close by.
