However, Francesco the owner recommend some of the best places to eat in ROME - definitely worth trying! the rooms are all spacious, clean, neat and has everything you could possible need. There was air -conditioning which was great given the HOT summer in Rome. The continental breakfast included in the price was satisfactory. Loved the great coffee. As an added bonus, we were able to leave our luggage in the hotel after check out as out flight was later in the evening. We were therefore able enjoy another day of leisurely sight seeing without having to worry about lugging our bags around. All in all a great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to see all the sites”
Reviews.Author: rmsr163
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were delighted at how convenient the location was to reach all the major sites in Rome; 5 minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and Pantheon. Also, only 5-7 minutes from Metro station and therefore only 5-10 minute train ride to Coliseum, Forum and Palatine Hills. The staff was friendly, very helpful and accommodating. The room was decorated nicely, decent size for the city, and had a flat screen TV. The breakfast was ample with choices of cereals, croissants, toasts, hard-boiled eggs, yogurts and fruit. This is a great place for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Every business should learn from the customer service that the staff of this bed & breakfast provide”
Reviews.Author: Arpana524
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and brother and law for 2 to 3 days. Great customer service, convenient location, staff with excellent attention to detail. I would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankythewish
Reviews.Content: first sorry for my first review I mistake. So I want to talk about residenza Ki little hotel in Roma. very sympatic hôtel with a wonderfull breakfast with so food to eat... very very well. then the staff is absolutely fantastic, very helpfull and nice thanks to Francesco, Andréa and Diogo. I was in Rome for job but they help me to conciliate job and pleasure. I will come back, for holidays with my family Now Im in France and my hotel is not so sympatic !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service and location. Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: ikciN44
Reviews.Content: Francesco was very helpful in telling us where to go and what to see. Breakfast was nice, simple but enough. Location was great. In walking distance of all the major sights. Rooms were clean and the quad was a perfect size for the four of us. Quads can be hard to find but these were very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Julie-AnnHamill
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this beautiful hotel with family for 4 nights, very well situated for everything that you need during your stay. The staff where very helpful always on hand to assist you especailly with directions to places. Would recommend this place for future holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SunnyinSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at this hotel. Francesco helped us plan out our stay and even got us a bottle of wine because we were celebrating our Anniversary. Great location, close to everything! It is on a nice quiet side street, but a block away from major roads to navigate Rome. Will definitely stay again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wish for a better location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: sarah_3939
Reviews.Content: Great central location, only a 10 minute walk from the train station or two minutes from the nearest metro station. Two minutes from the trevi fountain and the spanish steps and easy access to other key sites. The hotel itself is located in a quiet side street and has double glazing to keep out the noise of the nearby main road, there is air conditioning in the bedrooms which ensures a good nights sleep! Hotel staff are friendly, knowledgable about the local area and happy to give advice on how to get around the city. Rooms are comfortable and modern, our bathroom was small but perfectly formed. Breakfast was continental buffet, great selection of pastry's, bread, cold meats, jams, cereals etc. coffee and tea were freashly made by staff, greate latte's and capachinos! Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Princess724s
Reviews.Content: The staff at Residenza Ki were very friendly, welcoming, accomodating and helpful with anything we needed during our stay in rome. We felt like it was our home away from home not a hotel, they made sure to get to know us by name instead of room number. I would 100% go back and stay at Residenza Ki when I visit Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “great B&B on a PERFECT location in the city center”
Reviews.Author: Veule
Reviews.Content: great Bed&Breakfast on a perfect location near the city highlights

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed and Breakfast in a big city.”
Reviews.Author: karenlm2ooo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean,comfortable and in an amazing location in the center of Rome ,from there all the major places like the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps were within walking distance .We were treated not like guests but like family ,Francesco was very helpful and arranged all our tours and gave us great tips on which restaurants to visit and what the best times were for places like the Vatican.Andrea took care of our brakfast in the morning and it was perfect ,she made us the best cappuccino in town and then prepared our room for when we returned later in the evening .For me and my best friend Rosa staying in Residenza Ki was the best decision we made and we can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place-Excellet location”
Reviews.Author: eri76
Reviews.Content: Me , my husband and my sister stayed at Residenza Ki for 3 nights. we were met from the lovely manager Fancesco that answered all our questions about Rome. Very frendly service and lovely breackfast daily. The hotel is in the midle of everything that you want to see. Trevi Fountain is 2min walk , Piazza Barbirini 5 min walk, Piazza Navona and Pantheon 7-10min lovely walk , everithing is near and nice restaurants around. We would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Holiday was cancelled after a family death and they kept all our money!!!”
Reviews.Author: simbot82
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I were due to stay here for the first week of our holiday in mid may. My wifes Grandfather sadly passed away 4 days prior to our flight and we had to cancel. We rang that very day to allow all hotels time to have our rooms relisted and booked by other travellers. All hotels and museums showed compassion except for the Hotel Residenza Ki. Through all contact we were at first offered nothing in return and given the standard "non-refundable rate" clause. Whilst we understand the need for such a rate and its application surely some compassion could be afforded. Then we were informed that perhaps we might be refunded 50%. Then perhaps we could be credited for a stay when we could reschedule our flight and as their final offer they informed us that graciously they would keep our initial booking (over 600 euros) and allow us to rebook at a later date at a discounted rate. In a nutshell give them still more money. After 5 or more emails and over an hour in phone calls we still had not recieved any compassion and as a final insult my wife was informed by the Residenza Ki via email that "surely she should be focusing on her family and not money at such a time". For us that was the final straw. We were so excited to visit Rome and stay at this hotel. It may be highly rated but do you want to stay at a place which profits off the grief and loss of others with abolutely no compassion?

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alpi23
Reviews.Content: It was a fabulous trip, and I will come back in this hotel, everybody is cool, it was fantastic, Thank you at everybody, I will speak to your hotel to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “great place - awesome location”
Reviews.Author: SaraJane17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ki for a week with a friend and we were met with a clean/neat room, friendly service, breakfast daily, and an overall positive experience. The Ki has an absolutely ace location--it's just blocks from Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, and Piazza Barberini. It's within walking distance of EVERYTHING in Rome, including the Colosseum and I'd highly reccomend staying there to anyone, especially those with an interest in ancient or papal Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: jiil
Reviews.Content: i am currently travelling around europe and have stayed at a range of hotels. I arrived in Rome after 14 hours on a train to be warmly greeted by Francesco he explained all the best places to go and provided me with map. Was very warm and friendly and is the best check in service i have had. the breakfast was good and the expresso is exellent if you are into coffee. Great location near everything...... Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: campingvogn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location with nice, clean and very nice newly renovated rooms. The staff was friendly and there was a buffet breakfast with cereal, bread, different types the italian way. It was nice that it was possible with transfer to ond from the airport. The price was low and I would prefer to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel - Great service - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Carsten_H_Denmark
Reviews.Content: We did arrive late, and the reception was closed and so was the front door. But a note at the door showed us where to get our key to frontdoor and our room.Our fault that we did not let Residenza Ki know in advance that we would be late. The great service at this little cozy hotel kept on during our stay. Breakfast is perfect, and dont hesitate asking for more coffee/cappucino it´s made instantly with a tender touch. The location is great. No need to use public transportation, put on your walking shoes instead and enjoy the short distance to almost anything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ALSvendsen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location with small, but clean and very nice newly renovated rooms. The staff was friendly and there was a buffet breakfast with cereal, bread, different types of coffee etc. Plenty of food. Only reason why I don't rate it with 5 stars is that one of the beds was very (=too) soft and saggy. It is their next project to change this (after renovating the rooms), if this happens I think it will be the perfect hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “General feeling – for a week we felt like real Roman citizens!”
Reviews.Author: an_lit
Reviews.Content: Residenza Ki Hotel is brilliant for those who are trying to avoid transport while in Rome. Most of the city historical and cultural musts are within walking distance. And just in case you decide to visit Vatican or any other remote corner of Rome, the Barberini underground station is round the corner. Location - could not be better! Rooms – clean and being cleaned every morning, warm – if you come in colder times, don’t know about summer, hopefully cool. Stuff is very friendly and helpful!). Breakfast – a variety of choice, bread always fresh and delicious. And if served with a smile, lasts for a long time. Plenty of smiles guaranteed. Hotel administration – non-intrusive, yet caring. General feeling – for a week we felt like real Roman citizens!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fresh rooms at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: sctMora
Reviews.Content: We got a lot of advices how to see as much as possible during our 3 days in Rome from the staff at the reception. They where very serviceminded. Room was good, clean with comfortable beds. The breakfast was poor, but the breakfast-room was just renovated, so the staff hadn´t got it all going as I´m sure it will further on. A good accomodation for a decent price. Sven and Catharina, Sweden.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Gladys4412
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Ki is great. As long as you don't mind a few flights of stairs (which the staff will help you with your suitcases with!), this is a great place to be. It's close to a subway station and the Trevi Fountain, the rooms and the breakfast is great, and the staff couldn't be more helpful! Right next to a few reasonable places to eat in case of night-time or early morning cravings, cable TV and an hour of free wireless internet, along with a good-sized bathroom and a great setup, we couldn't ask for anything more in the Residenza Ki!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, very friendly staff and delicous breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: rachel_b28
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The Bed and Breakfast has a great location and the breakfast was lovely. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: oscardanefors
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a cosy family-owned hotel with a perfect location. The owners are very friendly and helpful and you will get your moneys worth if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: nyfep
Reviews.Content: Residenza Ki is located right in the heart of Rome -- within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, the Spanish Steps. The Barberini metro stop is practically around the corner. This is a true Bed & Breakfast -- it is located in an apartment building. As others have said there is no elevator so you do have to carry your luggage up and down the stairs. However your hosts, Diogo and Francesco will surely help you. We arranged for a cab to pick us up at the airport so finding the hotel was not a problem for us, although I can see why people might have a problem locating it -- there is no sign so you need to look for the building number. The breakfast served every morning is very good, delicious pastries, bread, meats, cheeses, fruit. Our first morning there they also had yogurt, however for the rest of the week they seemed to have run out. The cappuccino and espresso is amazing, we always had to have two cups each morning. The women who run the breakfast room are very sweet. We stayed on the first floor, and given the fact that the hotel is in a very busy, touristy part of town, it was extremely quiet. Guests on the second floor literally wake up and walk directly into the breakfast room -- so be aware of that when booking a room. Our room was very clean, a nice size, the bed was very comfortable, but furnished very sparingly. We were lucky we were given a chair to keep in our room, so we had another surface to put things. However, the reason we were given the chair was due to the fact that the armoire to hang your clothes was made for someone playing for the New York Knicks. The bathroom was also very clean, nice shower, great water pressure, but again very few surfaces to keep toiletries. If you like to do any kind of stretching or morning exercise be aware that the floors are marble and extremely hard. Maybe bring your own yoga mat along. As another fellow traveler mentioned the wifi in the hotel was not working during our week-long stay, which was a bit of a pain since we lugged our computer with us and wasn't able to use it at all. Also during our stay our two hosts were dealing with some personal/health problems and were not around as much as we assume they normally are. We still have to say if you are a self-reliant traveler, don't need a lot of hand-holding, no 24-hour desk service or concierge - then we do highly recommend Residenza Ki -- you truly feel like you have your own apartment in Rome. But if you are expecting a true hotel -- this would not be the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: teaterspoket
Reviews.Content: Average hotel in a great location, clean, nice staff, simple breakfast, hard to find - no sign! The bed was too short for my tall, teenaged son (1, 98 cm) otherwise the bed quality was good.

Reviews.Title: “Just go”
Reviews.Author: Casdub
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Ki was a great place to stay. Perfectly situated between the spanish steps and the trevi fountain. Barberini metro stop was just 5minutes walk away. The one thing better then the location was the staff, especially Francesco. As soon as you get there you get a map from him circled with all the local attractions. And most of them are local, if you really dont want to walk hop on the metro for 2 stops(which comes every 2mins) and your practically there. Ask about the ROMA PASS which makes everything a breeze. One thing to know as well to save yourself a tenner in a taxi-when you get to Termini train station from the airport the Metro station is directly underneath. Go 2 stops to Barberini and its just a couple of minutes walk from the Metro and mostly downhill! We had a great stay, any question we had Francesco would try his best to answer, and he may have a tale or two to regale you with also. The room was well maintained, comfortable, very clean and there is air conditioning(that works) and sky tv if you really need it. It was basic enough but we werent there for the room. All in all a wonderfully stress free long weekend in a beautiful city. Cant ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff that cant be beated!!”
Reviews.Author: linkyta
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I had the pleasure to visit Rome, this time I took my mom with me. I chose the Residenza based on the reviews and the location and we cant be more pleased We arrived in the afternoon, had a bit of trouble finding the place, since it's in an apartment building, not an actual hotel. But then we saw the doorbell corresponding to the Residenza, unfortunately we didnt get an immediate answer and we got a little nervous, but a charming gentleman who came out of the building was really nice and dialed the number that was indicated in the doorbell, but at the same time Diogo came in and took us inside. I emphasize: THERE'S NO ELEVATOR IN THE BUILDING, the reception is in the first floor and in our case the room was on the 2nd. So either workout before you go or pack lite ;-P ! The place was incredibly clean. Our bedroom was seriously large and comfy, the bathroom was regular sized and spotless (I really liked the mirror). The only downside was that they had a failure with the internet service and during our 3 day stay we couldn't go online wireless, but Diogo offered us to use his computer. One interesting detail is that you get SKY system in your tv, not that you want to watch much tv when in Rome but I've been to a couple european hotels and you only get a couple of channels when staying at budget friendly places The breakfast room was cozy and Andrea was always checking if she could get you anything. Breakfast itself is good: cold meats, buns, toast, fresh juice and fruit and delicious cappuccinos or lattes made at the moment. I really liked the fact that they give you your keys and it's like you have your own apartment in Rome! (that gets perfectly cleaned everyday :-) ) And the location is unbeatable: 20 min s max of a delicious walk get you everywhere, in fact, Trevi fountain is 2 blocks away! Metro station is a 2 min walk and the fastest way to get to the Vatican. We really recommend this place for anyone who is in a no frills mood, wants to be in the middle of everything and be greeted by the friendliest staff ever

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay to see all the sights in walking distance”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth074
Reviews.Content: Residnza Ki is a little gem of a hotel. The location is fantastic, nestled between Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The Staff were extreamly friendly and helpful providing maps and advice to help us not to miss anything during our stay. The breakfast were fresh and plentiful and they even provided an early breakfast on our departure.

Reviews.Title: “location & staff”
Reviews.Author: rightrichard78
Reviews.Content: Mr Diogo was fantastic all rooms all renovated and breakfast was excellent. I would suggest to all fúture guest to organize a meeting point to have a check in like i did.

Reviews.Title: “it's a gem”
Reviews.Author: robhil57
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a short 5 minutes walk from trevi fountain and spanish steps, the only time we used the metro was to get to the vatican,althourg this probably would still only have been a 45 minutes walk away. The staff at residenza ki - really friendly - from the front desk to the weitress expecially andrea in the breakfast room. -great service (it's great when someone remembers how you take your coffee from the firt morning and has it ready for you every day for the rest of the trip). the breakfast was also great ...big selection of pastries,cereal,juice,bread cheese salami and ham,eggs and homemade cakes, but the most important was a personal greeting to my girlfrien who was celebrating her birthday and had a nice bootle of chianti waiting for us in the room when we arrived....A LOVELY TOUCH. i booked this hotel based on a combination of tripadvisor ranking and price and had a very positive experience for 4 nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: josrob40
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Rome. I Spent 3 days with my family for my birtday,best in my life,the cake's present from residenza ki was delicius and we offered also to the other guest. residenza ki staff was excelent ,loved the location and the hotel,clean and very confortable.

Reviews.Title: “nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: senador
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel just for 2 nights on internet but at least I decided to spend there 3 nights more because the structure was more than I expected,very clean room,fantastic staff,marvellous breakfast a I can also saw my team soccer on television for champion league.great and excellent position.don't believe to all rewiews my experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Semicolon2010
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at the Residenza Ki while on vacation in Rome. It's a real hidden gem, two short pedestrian-only blocks from Trevi Fountain, and a short walk from the Metro. The rooms are clean and very spacious for a hotel in this price range, the bed comfortable, and the service was really exemplary. Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place, horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: efapallo
Reviews.Content: I (26 years) stayed with my mother (61) in Residenza Ki for four nights 23-27.12 and it was horrible!!!! The whole "hotel" is rotten, everywhere is black mould growing from the walls, they have a huge humidityproblem. And the solution is to paint the black mould spots with chaulkpaint! As a doctor I can tell you, it doesn't help anything! The mould is so deep in the walls that the whole building should get torn down so people wouldn't breathe the spores in their lungs and get a bronchitis, asthma etc. Everything in the hotel was broken; the beds were broken, the bedspreads had holes and all kinds of stains (disgusting white stains..) on them, as well as one of our matrasses had huge stains of urine or faeces on it! The only chair in the room had different kinds of stains on it. There hadn't been cleaned in ages, on the walls were stains and on the sideboards loads of dust. There was no hook for towels in the bathroom, it had fallen off and no one had bothered to fix it, in the wall were just the holes. The shampoostand in the shower was totally rusty. The dustbin was broken. The drain in the shower didn't work so as I showered the water flood on the floor of the bathroom and from under the door in the room. As I noticed it I had to soak it up with my towel fot the next 10 minutes. As I got new towels and explained the problem of the overflow to the cleaninglady she seemed to think it was perfectly normal. In the toaster from the breakfastroom only one side worked, the cleaninglady had to tell her guests every day the left side doesn't work. They serve some kind of croissants and danish pastry for breakfast. On 3 of our 4 breakfasts there was this same peace of pastry in the vitrine which contained quark and eggs, so it was definately not eatable after the first morning. But it was every mornig offered to the hotelguests. Probably someone ate it on our 4. morning, then it was gone. On our last mornig I must have gotten a foodpoisoning from the cold eggs, which had been cooked god knows when, and vomited and sat on the toilet for 24h. The personal was unfriendly and always tried to get up with excuses as I complained about for example the mould. As I told one of the staff I had been in better hostels than in this so-called hotel he even admitted he believed this. He tried to tell me something about italian standards, but I don't think this explanation is enough. We are in the EU and have standars that even Italy has to follow. I wouldn't recommend this shabby "hotel" to anyone!! The room I am talking about is by the way the room shown on their own internetpage, but the fotos must have been taken about 20 years ago. The adress Via Rasella 53 is by the way wrong, checking in is in number 56 and there is not "Residenza Ki" displayed there but something else about Bed and Breakfast. Didn't know that in the middle of the night. The telephone number on the doorbell of 53, that by the way doesn't work, is also wrong. As well as the number on their own internetpage is wrong. So I went to another hotel nearby and the nice portier made 5 phonecalls to reach our real "hotel". At 1.30 in the night. In my opinion the whole hotel was such a mess, absolutely horrible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location, pretty dirty though”
Reviews.Author: steveofcanberra
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week from late Nov to early Dec 09. Staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast lady is very nice also. Location is awesome. 3min to Trevi, 5min to spanish steps and train station. I would not stay here again though. Unfortunately there was SO much mould in the bathroom I didnt want to touch the walls while I was having a shower. I went to the local supermarket and bought a bottle of bleach I was that disgusted. The floors in the room are tiled. Walk round the room in bare feet for 2 min and then look at your feet.. Ewww!!! The floors have like never been mopped and look ok at first glance but are actually really filthy. Apart from that, the room was great and everything else appeared clean and functional enough. So yeah, by all means stay here, its just that our room was pretty feral in the bathroom and the tiles were dirty. Also there was no hot water for our last 2 days on our floor (1st floor) as the boiler apparently stuffed up. Communication could have been a little better... as in they could have offered us another room on another floor. So yeah, I wont stay here again nor will recommend it, but I may have just had a bad experience as everyone else's review seem pretty positive.

Reviews.Title: “it's a gem”
Reviews.Author: robert13Wyoming
Reviews.Content: residenza ki is fantastic.We booked it for location but we found it so lovely.the staff very helpful,diogo can suggest you nice restaurant and how visit the eternal city in the best way to save time and money,consider it, this is important . In a breakfast in the morning you can find past,ham,salame and some cake i would raccomand to try espress italiano. they clean every day the room. so we definetely reccomand this place. rob& mary

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: 74denism
Reviews.Content: perfect location,deligtful staff and pleasant room.What could be more perfect?residenza ki is a gem,planted within a short stroll from so many of the top acttraction (walk to trevi fountain in 2 minutes,Spanish steps in 3 and pantheon in ten minutes).the front desk staff are faboulos.My favourite was Francesco,but they are all wonderfull.the breakfast room is small but pleasant.there was a nice selection of breads,fruits,meats and cheese. this is ideal hotel to enjoy this fabulous city

Reviews.Title: “Family Holidays”
Reviews.Author: browncurtis17
Reviews.Content: Our family ot three stayed at residenza ki in september . first two night were in a small room,then we upgraded to a large rooms for a large rooms for the final two nights. The residenza Ki has the best location in rome.We walked everywhere from this hotel.the decor was nice.the staff was helpful and breakfast was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: vladVilnius
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with helpful staff, room and breakfast was fine and location fantastic. I was a solo travel but i found a new friends in Rome. nice suggest for restaurant and good organization for the airport . i come back again

Reviews.Title: “around europe”
Reviews.Author: 35steve
Reviews.Content: what a nice place to live Rome! We spent four days and we really feel like home.thise place is managed from a family,they told us,so ewerything well done. they take care about clean,about breakfast fresh croissant ham,salame,cheese,fresh fruit salad and homemade cake. Room are good always cleaning.the staff is fantastic they help us with map and suggestion for restaurant and museum.but the best quality of residenza ki s the location... 2 minutes to arrive in trevi fountain and spanish steps,you can forget bus and metro if you like walking like us just to know is 45 minutes to arrive in vatican city by walk and 20 by metro. we reccomend this place to all people want save a money choosing a good quality

Reviews.Title: “holidays”
Reviews.Author: cmartin087
Reviews.Content: Amazing relation quality and price.Delicius breakfast,free wifi,central location. The restaurant suggested from all staff was fantastic and chip. Francesco suggested non touristic restaurant i promise to frank to don't write my preferite...please ask directly to Francesco i will come back

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dukeRotterdam
Reviews.Content: i have read the previous review and also i have to pay cash. we have asked explanations and the boy of the reception has explained to us that they were change operating telephone and they did not know when would be returned the line. we haven't problems because at the end of the street there was a ATM machine. fantastic location 2 minutes walking to arrive in spanish steps and trevi fountain,pick up service from and for airport was fantastic and efficient as a breakfast (we found cheese,salame,ham fresh croissant and fruits salad. staff always available and helpful i just suggested to my friend to choose in rome Residenza kI .

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: kenallroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable rooms and excellent service. The bathrooms were a slight disappointment in what would otherwise would have been a very enjoyable stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: EAAL
Reviews.Content: Via Rasella is a quiet street with little traffic. The entrance at #53 and the 24 hour reception at #56 almoust next door. Very helpful personal. We, four people, spent four nights in two twin beds and had all tourist sites within walking distance. Used the nearby underground station just once to get to the Vatican. Bathroom with shower all neat and clean, new towels every day. Breakfast with milk, coffee, cerials, toast, buns, pastry, different spreds, ham. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in the heart of Trevi”
Reviews.Author: bensgirlSydney
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just arrived back from Europe after a three week honeymoon and while in Rome we stayed at the Residenza Ki. The excellent service started from as soon as we made our booking. We received a confirmation from the hotel within an hour of making the booking (and considering we booked this accommodation after having major issues with the original hotel we had booked with this prompt confirmation was most welcome!) wanting to know the details of our flight or train and did they want us to organise a taxi to be waiting for us when we arrived in Rome. I can comment on two of the rooms, the family room 203 and the double room 205. When we arrived we were told that they had noticed a small problem with room 205 (not that this was something we noticed when we went to our intended room so it must have been fixed) and they upgraded us to a family room (room 203) so they could rectify the issue in our room. This forward thinking is not something that I have seen in budget chains and it was greatly appreciated by us. The family room was excellent, a queen and two single beds in the room so absolutely large enough for the family. It faces the street the hotel is on but is so quiet, very clean and modern room. The next day we were moved to the double room 205 (they moved everything for us, we did not have to do anything) and this room was also excellent. We had been travelling around Europe for about two weeks at this point and the previous double rooms we had stayed in were quite small and for the price we paid that is what we expected, but it wasn't that small at all. Might get a bit small if you want to spend all your time in your hotel room, but why would you want to do that, you are in Rome! Great room, again very clean (cleaned daily and linen changed daily)and quiet. And the rooms had air-conditioning which was most welcome due to how hot Rome can be (and was when we were there). The location of this hotel is fantastic, in a few minutes of walking you can be at the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Spanish steps and other monuments. You would expect the hotel based on the location to be noisy, but it is so quiet. Close to heaps of restaurants and cafes and about five minutes walk to the closest metro station. The free WiFi also came in handy. The service that we experienced from all of the staff is on par with what you would expect from a five star hotel, they were the nicest, most knowledgeable people that I have encountered in any country while travelling at any time. The knowledge of their city is excellent, the pride in their hotel and work is evident at all times and they were such lovely people. They asked us regularly if we were comfortable with everything or if there was anything they could do for us, it was great. They also provided a great daily breakfast and the women working in the mornings make awesome coffee! Needed when hungover from too many red wines at the great restaurants! I would (and have) recommended this hotel to anyone who is looking for a fantastic hotel in Rome in a great location with excellent staff. Now if you are used to the Hilton and expect the rooms to be like the Hilton you will be disappointed, remember that this is a three star hotel. But the service is better than a five star hotel and you will not be treated like a number like you can be when in a five star hotel and the rooms are great. These people will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home and that is just what you want when travelling in another country. We are looking at going back to Rome next year and we would go back to the Residenza Ki again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Best honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mrnroger80
Reviews.Content: Amazing honeymoon, one week in a comfortable situation with a fantastic staff .Nice room always cleaning and abundant buffet breakfast congratulation to Andrea for the cappucino. i would also say thanks Diogo Daniel and Francisco we want to you well marion and steve

Reviews.Title: “Great people at Residenza Ki!”
Reviews.Author: Praxitellis
Reviews.Content: Look Yeah there's more fancy places out there and for some that's what there after but the Residenza Ki has alot going for it here's a few things... Great location within walking distance to the Trevi yet Quiet side street so you can sleep (if you want) Rooms a nice maybe need a little touch up of paint but that can be forgiven. Really homely feel great check in with our man Francesco very knowlegable also the other fellows who do the night shift great bunch of guys! The Maid/Breakfast lady is GREAT and breakfast was good to.. Highly recommend this joint little touch up's and they'll be no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great Poroperty and Location”
Reviews.Author: djdarrendc
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from my 4 night stay at the Residenza Ki. We arrived early and we exhausted but were give a room early, which we were grateful for. Once in the room, I have to say that I was a little surprised as the room was quite small as was the bathroom. However, after the first night, it was not an issue at all. The reality is that we only used the hotel for the basics, at no time did either of us want to stay in the room and relax, hello...it's Rome, get out and enjoy the city. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating, we went out every night so we never made it to breakfast but I am sure it was great. I would tell anyone thinking of booking here, know what you are getting. If you think you are going to get a Mariott room for a motel 6 price than you are going to be disappointed. If you are looking for a clean, well managed property in an excellent location, than this is the place for you. Simply put, it does what a budget hotel room should do, provide a place to hang your clothes, get something to eat, shower and sleep. Diogo, Francesco and Danniello were all very polite, and gave every single person that we saw them interact with customized service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: IdaMari
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location, friendly helpful people and comfortable rooms. Our stay in Rome was perfect thanks to very good advices and guidance from the guys at the hotel. The guys at the reception and the housekeeper/ breakfast lady all gave us good advices on what to do in Rome. Very helpful! Airconditioned rooms with minibar made our stay even more pleasant! When we go back, we will definately book in to that hotel again, and we will be sure to recommend the place to our friends and family who are traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, very well situated, for a small stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Marcoandreszs
Reviews.Content: Very good advice of the desk clerk (Diego), for museums, restaurents, etc. A very pleasant stay thanks to the good reception of the staff of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: irakmp
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of Rome, the Residenza Ki is a nice hotel with some nice and helpful staff. Most of the sights can be reached by foot and the area around the hotel is very cozy with the Trevi Fountain within 100 m. Some great restaurants in the area around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Good Value”
Reviews.Author: yoozeer
Reviews.Content: My Family and I (2 children aged 15 and 11) stayed for 6 days in July 2009. This was the first time we have ever booked anything online and we chose Residenza Ki based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were very happy with our choice. This place is very ,very close to the Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps is also within walking distance of the hotel.The Metro system is a 5 min walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is clean and well run. Francesco and the other staff members were more than willing to offer their recommendations to any of our questions. Our stay included breakfast and we were happy with the selection of items in the am.The lady working the Breakfast room in the morning was very pleasant and attended to you promptly with coffee and hot chocolate for the kids. All in all i would recommend Residenza Ki as a good Value for both price and location

Reviews.Title: “Great and cheap hotel, located near all the main attractions in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tamol
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything we were looking for! The room was clean and quiet, and with air condition we were able to get a good night sleep even though it was extremely hot in Rome during our stay. The staff was also very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located near all the main turist attractions in Rome. The Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps are both only 5-10 minutes away by foot, while the Pantheon and Piazza Navona can be reached within 10-15 minutes. We never felt the need to use public transportation or taxis when exploring the city. We felt we got good value for the money we spent, especially when considering the fact that the hotel was not very expensive compared to others in the same area and of the same standard. We would therefore like to give Residenzia Ki our best recommendations. Jørgen and Tale from Norway

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing/Dirty”
Reviews.Author: LoveItalia09
Reviews.Content: Oh what a disappointing experience for us while in Rome. Although we were close to the Trevi Fountain. The room was dirty and the shower disgusting, I had to buy cleaning supplies and clean the bathroom before using it, as the shower curtain was crunchy and stuck together, mold and mildew was everywhere, the drain did not work, so flooded the bathroom everytime we showered. Towels that were 2 days old and on the floor were picked up and hung up. The floor was never swept, so I found a broom and dustpan in a closet with no door that had many many other items in disarray, I swept our room daily. When the linens on the bed were changed they were made with holey (many holes)sheets. Bars on our windows and could not open the bathroom window. No safe, T.V did not work and we could not phone out of the hotel, when I asked how I could make a local call I was told rather rudely to use a pay phone. The linens on the tables in the breakfast room were dirty when we arrived and stayed dirty until we left. The floor in the breakfast room was not cleaned once in 5 days. Had tea the one morning we ate there and didn't get to finish it as the pot was needed for another person (they only had one teapot). We only ate breakfast here once (first morning) and then ate elsewhere due to the uncleanliness of the room. I will not be back. I had read the reviews before hand so was expecting something way different, obviously they had different rooms or we where put in a different hotel. We had paid before hand so would not get our money back if we moved to a different hotel, although I really wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!! mins to Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: mailman33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little difficult to find. The check-in office is located in what looks like a bed and breakfast/tour guide/travel agency office on the first floor. The staff was very friendly and courteous. Our room was in the building next door. You have to carry luggage 2 floors before you can use their extremely small elevator (1person+1luggage or 2ppl,no luggage). Our room was spacious, clean, and somewhat cool. Our private bathroom was located right outside our front door, across the hallway (which i thought was very weird). Breakfast was located on the fifth floor on a balcony overlooking several buildings which was a delight. The hotel is conveniently located minutes from the Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, and other major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice cool, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Poldcess
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in mid July and the city was HOT HOT HOT ! The rooms however were perfectly cool and air conditioned, a welcome relief! The room was spacious, comfortable, clean and the complimentary mini bar was a nice surprise as well. Shame we didn't realise this upon arrival as I'm sure we could have done more damage to it. Always plenty of hot water and a powerful shower, just what you need after a hard day's sightseeing. Coffee at beakfast was great, the rest was standard continental affair - bread, cheese, cereals, juice, ham. Fruit would have been nice, but there was plenty to keep us happy. The hotel was initially fifficult to find as it isn't labelled Residenza Ki and you have to go into the 'Fellini B&B' office two doors down. The very helpful Francesco explained that they had switched companies and everything would soon be renamed. Francesco and the other staff were all very helpful, providing maps, advice and directions. It is so close to all the popular sights and transport links, although nearly everything is in walking distance anyway. We would definitely stay again and would recommend it to friends and family. The Residenza Ki is very good value for your weak pound and, having stayed in innumerable continental hotels, far exceeds it's three stars. Thumbs up to Francesco and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Anstrav
Reviews.Content: Hotel was at a really good location, easy access everywhere. Our room was excellent for that purpose, we had 4 people staying in one room, which was a bargain. Quality of breakfast could have been better, but it was adequate as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for people on budget!”
Reviews.Author: Wolika
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The Trevi Fountain is very near, but not too near so you don't get bothered by too much tourist traffic. There are loads of proper Italian restaurants around...avoid anything that puts pictures of food on the menu! Kind of hard to find. It's near the bottom of the hill. On top of the hill you've the Bernini Hotel...just walk down and you'll find it. The hotel was good. Clean towels every day, room cleaned daily as well. The bed was comfortable and the place is pretty quiet at night (just normal traffic). The breakfast was okay, but the juices they offer are disgusting. Also, the drinks in the little fridge in the room must have been there for months cos they were all dirty (mouldy)from being in there for so long. Great place to stay in ROME!

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: ACRSydney
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in this B&B in October 2008. We found the location superb, very close to the Trevi fountain and the bustle of central Rome. The staff were helpful, and the rooms clean. Overall the price is good, and the location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit strange:)”
Reviews.Author: bulkaibublik
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend away in Rome having stayed at Residenza Ki for 2 nights. This Hotel itself is very hard to find since there is no sign outside so we walked past it couple of times. It is even more confusing because once you find the adress the name of the hotel does not match and the reception for residenza ki is at Fellini Inn.... The room 305 was not big, but clean apart from black hairs on the floor...that kept appearing (not ours!). The lack of bath was dissapointing, but shower was a good size and clean. The hotel is next to a arch type car tunnel so can get a bit noisy , depending where your room is but once the telly is on you can hardly hear the outside noise and the view from the window is nice anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good bargain”
Reviews.Author: FortyNineCountries
Reviews.Content: Mom and I decided to spend a week in Rome, and picked Residenza Ki because it offered a good price in a good location. We were disappointed on the first evening (a Saturday) because our room faced the street, and immediately below us was a restaurant that was holding an outdoor party. (I slept through it, but mom did not.) As it happens, they were going to move us to an interior room the next day anyway. We never had any problem with noise after that. In fact, the restaurant appeared to be closed during the week, and there was no party the following Saturday night. Apart from that, we had absolutely no problems. The room was always clean. Breakfast was always good. Francesco at reception was always friendly...each morning he would draw us a map of how to get where we were going that day. The hotel is small, tucked away on a little side street... in fact you have to "just know" that you check in at the Hotel Fellini next door. But this was definitely a plus, not a minus. There was always hot water. Lots of restaurants, bars, cafes, and so on nearby. The metro is a block away, as are main bus routes. We would usually spend our mornings walking to our destination, then take a bus back to our neighborhood in the evening, after dinner...we never had to change buses. The neighborhood felt perfectly safe at all times. In addition to English, I heard French, German, and several other languages in the breakfast room. It was an ideal little European inn, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly, best location, senstaional value”
Reviews.Author: artgal44
Reviews.Content: I can only say fantastic things about this great place to stay. Firstly, a sensational location. It really is close to the Trevi as they had descibed, and in fact close to everything. One of the great pleasures of Rome is to be able to walk to as much as possible, in order to take in the street life of this buzzing city. Residenza Ki really has one of the best locations, with a very reasonable cost. The rooms are good, clean, and you feel like you're living there as it's not like a hotel. The rooms are all off a common breakfast room. They have a lovely lady who prepares breakfast for guests every morning. We found the breakfast adequate ( a typical Italian buffet, just don't expect a big American style breakfast - after all, you're in Rome ) and the staff just fantastic. Diogo at the front desk (a couple of doors down the street from the building that the Residenza is in) is particularly helpful. He is warm and generous with his advice about any questions you may have, gives GREAT suggestions for the best places to eat, and assisted us with a great many things (as did Francesco). Do not expect a "big hotel" feel, this is more like having your own little place in Rome, which is so much better. We have stayed in many places, from small B&B's to luxury 5 star, but all in all, this is great value for the very best location and friendly service in Rome. A wonderful place to stay where you will feel like a local after only a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific B&B in Rome”
Reviews.Author: wisewithage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October of 2008 and had a very nice visit. The hotel is tucked away on a side street in Rome, close to the Metro station and near several bars, restaurants and shops. We stayed here for 2 nights and had 2 rooms. The staff was helpful and courteous and each morning we ate a terrific breakfast upstairs on the rooftop terrace. SImply a great way to start the day. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay: ResidenzaKi”
Reviews.Author: LKJM
Reviews.Content: ResidenzaKi offers a simple, quiet room near subway and bus stops that make it easy to get around Rome if you're OK with public transport. (Itis relatively user friendly in Rome). It is near the Trevi fountain. The rooms are clean and the room service staff kept them that way during our stay. The staff is friendly and helpful, particularly the desk staff. Francesco of the desk staff in particular went out of his way to help us on several occasions. The key situation to enter the room area from the street can be tricky. I couldn't extract the key from the lock until a kind employee of the next door restaurant came to my rescue and showed me the trick of it. The beds were servicable but not especially comfortable. Breakfast seem typical of Rome for this class of establishment. Cappucino is very good but since there aren't many tables compared to the number of rooms, it isn't a leisurely breakfast experience. Overall ResidenzaKi worked very well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great Residenza Ki”
Reviews.Author: LondonCamilla
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Opodo as it had a good central location and was reasonably priced. I had also read some very positive reviews on it. Overall, I found the hotel okay - no nightmares - but there are a few points that may be of help to others planning on staying there. Firstly, avoid room 205 - it is very small and looks nothing like their advertised picture. The bathroom left a bit to be desired (mouldy walls etc) and the air conditioning unit hadn't been plastered into the wall properly (bare wires and holes). On the plus side the room was clean and the breakfast good but three nights in this hotel was long enough. All rooms are advertised as having a safety deposit box but in reality at least two of the rooms safes wern't working. When we questioned this we were told at reception that a new safe would be brought in and that we were welcome to use the one behind the desk. We asked 3 times and nothing was done - in the end we just felt a nuisance, but we felt disinclined to leave large sums of cash in a shared safe as this would be a risk for the hotel (they're leaving themselves open to accusations, surely) as well as us. So we ended up carrying all our cash around with us - not a great idea in a city where the main crime is bag snatching. I even asked if they had another room with a working safe but they said the only rooms they had left were triples and, no, we couldn't exchange. Funny, at breakfast we saw the residence of each of the 6 or so rooms and none ever had more than two people staying in them.... When we arrived on the first day at 11 am we were told our room would not be ready until about 1pm. Official check in time is 2pm so we came back around 1.45pm. We then had to wait a further 45 mins until we could get into the room. Goodness knows what they were doing in such a small room - could have cleaned it myself in 20 mins. Official check out time in the hotel literature was 12 noon but on our last day we were told to vacate the room by 11am. We also took up the hotel's recommended airport collection taxi service . This cost Euro 45. If you get a regular taxi from Fiumicino they can only charge Euro 40 by law, so this was fair enough. However, on our last day we were told by other residents about a service called Roma Shuttle, which only charges Euro 30 for 2 people back to the airport. We tried to book this through the hotel but were told it was booked up. They seemed to know all about it but hadn't told us. Unfortunately there was a train strike on that day too so we had to get one of their taxis back as well. Some general info that may be of help in Rome: You can buy metro/train tickets in the stations - we were told metro tickets had to be bought from a newsagents shop. A single trip ticket valid for 75 mins costs only Euro 1 - bargain! I had read that if you have a small appetite and only want one or two courses eat in a trattoria or pizzeria instead of a formal restaurant (where they expect you to have the full four courses plus wine). Well even the most basic trattoria was not very amenable when we said we only wanted mains and soft drinks. They charged Euro 7 - 8 for two Cokes. And they expected a large tip (the norm in the UK is 10%) So either ignor the rudeness or be prepared to plough your way through four courses!! And don't fall for any 'cover charge' as this is now illegal in Rome. Overall we did have a great time - Rome is an amazing city, and coming from London we felt very safe - there's not much violent crime there. So just wear your bag slung across you and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday yet !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cas45
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say. This holiday is the most memorable to date. The hotel was brilliuant including all the staff who work there. They were so helpful and made our stay worth while. Also they took time out to greet us every morning as we tried to say a few words in Italian and they also spoke good English. The maids who served us at breakfast were great warm and friendly and our room was spotless we just couldn't fault anything at all. We would also reccomend this place to anyone wishing to stay in Rome as it was also a great location. Thankyou and a big Grazie to the Residenza Ki from Carol and Ian Manchester England.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: Edjimundo
Reviews.Content: Residenza Ki is fine for a basic short stay. Slightly confusing in that you check in a few doors down from the B&B - this had not been explained when we booked. Residenza Ki has a quiet, central location (five minute walk to the Trevi Fountain) and is clean and safe. Breakfast is fine and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “everything was good,but just some problems that u need to know”
Reviews.Author: IrelandYip
Reviews.Content: the hotel name is different from the website that i booked with....the staff are good...cleaniness was ok,just they didn't change towel as we stayed there for 3 nights....also,the pillows weren't comfortable to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find in the centre of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LucyLogic8
Reviews.Content: Ki is made up of a couple of apartments in a building a few doors along from the reception of it's sister hotel Fellini, where you check in. Diago was very welcoming, helpful and polite and our room 101, a triple, was a good size and in very good decorative order with great air con, a fridge, tv and comfy beds. The bathroom was newly refurbished (the water temperature was a bit erratic but we could live with that!) and the whole place was lovely and quiet. The breakfast was great with good choice and a nice lady serving. They were happy to hold our bags for us in a locked room for the day and ready with advice and suggestions at all time, all the staff were great. It really exceeded our expectations and was definitely great value for money for the location - maximum 20 minutes walk to most sights and we would definitely recommend it to anyone and will certainly stay here again. There's a great little restaurant in the next street called something like Pisca Piano which served lovely food at good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place , Staff and Location superb”
Reviews.Author: ozzykiwitravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early June, The location of this place is so central. It is only minutes walk to the Trevi Fountaion, Spanish Steps, and the Coliseum. The metro is at the top of the street.not to mention minutes from fabulous shopping.The room was more than adequate being reasonably spacious by European standards, and also remarkably quiet considering its locale. We have to say that what made this stay so special was the people that work at this hotel.We arrived late in the afternoon ,we were greeted by a young man by the name of Diago who guided us through the map of the area pointing out the highlights and what to be aware of then helped us to our rooms, explaining where breakfast was served etc etc and all spoken in English which can alievate any stress trying to make yourself understood in a foreign speaking country .Reception is manned 24/7 and another delightful young man , Francesco made us so welcome and couldn't be more helpful, taking time from his busy job to explain things to us that we would probably have never known about . I have to say it is the people that make these stays so special and memorable. I would recommend this place anyone

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: 6scootergirl6
Reviews.Content: Stay for four nights in a double room. Rooms was clean, shower was either too hot of too cold some of the time. breakfast suffiicient and staff friendly. The hotel is in a fantastic location to walk to most of Rome's famous sights. Overall though had a lovely city break. Warning - taxi driver tried to steal some of our money by distracting my boyfriend as he got his cash out to pay him, luckily he spotted the taxi driving doing this. He was very quick and had obviously done this before. Would advice if using taxi for the person who pays to sit in the back of the vehicle. Take care, and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: holli63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and had great experience. Hotel clean and very friendly. Ideally located for all the sights. Only complaint was the cost of prebooked taxi (we arrived late at night so hotel arranged a taxi) -80 euros. Flagged a "white cab for return to airport & it cost us 35 euros! Provided you do not want 4 star facilities this is fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown rome”
Reviews.Author: RaeSK
Reviews.Content: Residenza Ki is a great hotel with the perfect location for those wishing to experience the culture and sights of Rome. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly! We stayed at both of their locations Fellini B&B and Residenza Ki. THe rooms are clean, the bathrooms are clean, you feel right at home. For us it was the staff that made the experience- they go out of their way to help you with whatever you might need - even asking the bar across the street for a bag of ice to cool our beer!

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: JeryA
Reviews.Content: We had booked for 3 nights, but when we arrived the staff (Francesco) told us that we would have to change rooms in the morning, so our bags should be packed and ready to leave the room after the breakfast. When I asked for why this was, and what our next room would be he (Francesco) said that he didn’t know, But for the inconvenience he promised us a much better and bigger room, so we shouldn’t worry. So we packed our bags again and left them with the staff. When we came back to the hotel that evening we found that the room given us this time was a DUMP!!! The room was shabby, small and dirty. The bathroom was cramped and dirty with a shower that didnt have warm water half of the time. There was fungus on the shower walls (see pictures) and the shower was so dirty!! When we complained about this to the night courier he said that we had to wait to the morning as he couldn’t do anything for us. So we had to sleep on dirty "double bed" which was 2 singles put together with a gap in between so sleep wasn’t possible in anyways. In the morning we were told that all rooms where full and there was nothing they could do about this. When I questioned the fact that I had booked for 3 nights in a double bedroom and got 1 night and the rest been packing and unpacking and staying in a dump the guy from the staff said he apologizes about this and blamed it on Francesco. He admitted that it wasn’t unusual that staff would “sell” already booked rooms to tourists walking into the hotel, and that the situation with our room could have been such an event. That the room we got was the "extra room" in the hotel and not a normal room for customer already booking. What apparently had happened was that our room had been given to another quest because the hotel could get more money per night out of our room, and we who had booked in advance where given the worst and cheapest room because they already knew we had paid. As an evidence to this we have made sure to take photos of the room which was a dump, and also a letter from the staff in the Rezidenza KI where they apologize for the situation and admit to the fact that they changed our rooms in purpose to get more money. At end of the letter they ask us not to tell anyone about fraud as it would lead them to lose their jobs! I don’t recommend this hotel to ANYONE! For the money you spend you expect to go somewhere safe but this hotel and the staff are not trustworthy.

Reviews.Title: “Homely Reidenza Ki”
Reviews.Author: EssexEasyrider
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank you on behalf of my wife and I for making us so welcome on our recent visit with you. I would especially like to thank Diego for his attentiveness and helpfulness, but indeed all of the staff were very helpful and made our stay idyllic. Your residenza was exactly the type of accommodation that I was looking for when booking, with charm and also an air of a family home – rather than the antiseptic atmosphere of the larger chains of hotels that are in large cities. We were lucky with the weather and cannot express the quality of the sites that Rome has to offer but that combined with the Residenza Ki made our stay just magnifico! Once again, many thanks for helping to make our visit so very special and I can assure you that I would not have second thoughts of recommending your establishment to any and all of my friends and acquaintances that might be contemplating visiting Rome in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TripperToo
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reading reviews of hotels in Rome on the TripAdvisor web site before deciding on this hotel, and it definitely paid off. The Residencia Ki is a clean, comfortable hotel with extremely reasonable rates and an excellent location - just a few blocks from both the Fountain of Trei and the Spanish Steps. I arrived early in the morning with a reservation for two nights and was greeted enthusiastically, offered a cup of coffee and invited to sit down and have breakfast. After I finished eating I was very apologetically told that despite my reservation the hotel was overbooked for the first night of my stay, but arrangements had been made for me to stay at another, higher priced hotel a couple of blocks away with the difference in price paid for by Residenza Ki. I was escorted to the other hotel, where I was well received. Although that hotel was fine (it was priced about 30% higher) and I was ok with the accomodation, I found Residenza Ki, where I did stay my second night, preferable. The atmosphere there was warmer, less sterile and more comfortable. When I did check out before a full day of sightseeing, the staff at Residenza Ki was not at all hesitant to let me keep my luggage there to pick up that evening when I left Rome. As promised, they took good care of a parcel of easily breakable ceramic and glass gifts I had purchased. I stayed in several hotels while in Italy, and although I was pleased with all of them, Residenza Ki defintiely provided the best value and the best overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: koakakola
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little hard to find but the reception area is moving a couple of doors down which should make it a lot easier to find. The rooms are basic, but extremely clean and in good working order. The location is second to none, the hotel is very close to the trevi fountain, spanish steps and barberini metro....right in the middle of Rome's historical centre. The best part of the hotel is the service. Diego manages the hotel and is the most helpful person you could wish to meet. He suggested places to go, places to eat, made reservations for us, etc. His efforts really made this a great holiday and not just a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: blueDmx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Lastminute.com. Firstly, the location is great! We didn't realise how good it was until maybe a second day when we decided to go through a little lane and came out by the Trevi Fountain which was a great surprise! Firstly, we couldn't find the hotel easily. There is no big sign and it took 2 trips up and down the street wondering if we had missed it to find it. (Tip: pay attention to the door numbers!!) We were greeted at the door and went up 3 floors... (there is no lift for those who would prefer it). We were told that we had to stay in a family room as they were over booked and then change the following night. This was fine with us.. until we went to sleep! Firstly the ceiling had a big hole in it which was covered by a blanket, and the bed was the most uncomfortable bed i think we've ever stayed in! It was creaky with every tiny move, the pillows were just rubbish. The bathroom was tiny and for a family room I was surprised at it's size. Anyway, we changed rooms the next day as we expected to, they told us in the morning that we could stay in our family room for the rest of our stay as they had a cancellation, but we decided to move anyway, we needed a good night sleep! Our second room was much better, even though it was off the reception/breakfast area. We did not find it very noisy but could quite possibly get noisy depending on how many people were staying. OUr bed was much better, but still a little hard, teh pillows flat and the room was freezing but once we worked out the aircon/heater it was fine. The bathroom was much better, more spacious than the last room so we settled in perfectly. The breakfast was simple and the coffees delicious. I probably wouldn't stay here again, purely for the comfort of the bed, however, the hotel is in an excellent location so would recommend on this basis for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rezidenza Ki Rome”
Reviews.Author: Daiana_60
Reviews.Content: Dany, Tel Aviv January 17th,2008 We just returned from Rome. The family hotel Rezidenza Ki is in the middle of everywhere.You can walk to almost every" must see" place in Rome. The rooms are not big but clean.A chair and a small table would be nice.Nice accommodation and great location The second best thing to the location is the staff. First we met Diego who was very kind.10x Diego. On the next day and for the rest days of our stay in Rome there was Gigi. Gigi was more than helpful,very attentive, very nice and pleasant . He also helped us with the luggage . As it happened it was my daughter's birthday.As we sat down to have our breakfast we heard from the computer nearby the song "Happy birthday" and a delicious small cake with lighted candles was presented to her.Needless to say that we were extremely touched. They arranged a private car service to take us from and to the airport , which was a good service, and much appreciated. Thank you Gigi once more.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: studenttraveller1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. Located in the centre of Rome it is within walking distance to all the attractions of the city and it is close to at least two metro stations that allow access to the outer areas of Rome as well. When we arrived we were made to feel very welcome wirth coffee and breakfast while our room was prepared (even though we arrived before check-in time!). Gigi, the local who works on reception, gave us a map and circled everywhere we needed to go. he knew how long we were staying and so recommended where to go and when, as well as where to avoid in order to avoid crowds and areas that were too touristy. Gigi told us all the local secrets and was able to recommend restaurants and detailed transport information. He was always friendly and ready to help with anything we needed. The room was lovely as was the atmosphere of the whole hotel, which is very small and cosy, making you feel priveleged to stay there. We were very lucky we found this hotel as it is a real treasure and made us feel welcome in a foreign and new city where we could easily have felt lost. The food and services provided were lovely, and very fitting for the price we paid. Overall, I'd really recommend this wonderful hotel and I will certainly be staying there if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Receptionist Gigi”
Reviews.Author: kaklis
Reviews.Content: Very good place for a tourist . you can walk everywhere in the town. Clean rooms. Excellent service due especially to GIGI.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkWil
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. 2nd floor. adequate rooms - very good value for the price. Gigi so helpful and always makes welcoming coffee when you get back. Good advice about transport and the sights. Good value all round and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant location”
Reviews.Author: holiday0
Reviews.Content: This is a great little residence, in a great location, only a stones throw from the Trevi Fountain. Plenty of little Restaurants, and bars right on its doorstep. A real taste of Rome. The room was spotless, with T.V. and DVD player, nicely furnished. Clean towels supplied each day and hot water in shower at all times. Great Coffie from GIGI the Manager, I will definitely go back, Gigi was very helpful and friendly. I dont think anyone could fault this little place. Breakfast also very good. Thanks GIGI

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chinaplate
Reviews.Content: On arrival Gigi made us welcome and even made a cappuccino. The information and friendliness Gigi and the location of this hotel made our stay. We were about two minutes from teh Trev fountain and short walk to the metro. The rooms are clean and suitable for families.

Reviews.Title: “nothing less than a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: polliciccio
Reviews.Content: This place was just fantastic. Consider a little hotel, 10 rooms only, with a really friendly staff, new confortable rooms, all service included...nothing less than a 4 star hotel. And at least the location...you really stay in Rome. I'll definetely spend all my holidays in Rome there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: akira2
Reviews.Content: Hidden away in a normal street in a normal building, this little hotel was at first hard to find. Once found however, it was easy understand why other reviewers say this hotel is close to major locations! Within 5 mins from the Trevi fountain, who could ask for more? Dont expect a brightly lit reception. On arrival you are given your set of keys and shown your room. Its pretty much self-service - great for travellers who want to avoid the usual hotel experience. The rooms are basic but clean, and the service is friendly. At breakfast on the first morning, Francesco (owner?) gave us a brief guide of the city with the aid of a map. Hospitable and helpful man. The breakfast was simple but wholesome, and the kitchen serves a nice expresso to start the morning. Dont expect 5 star pleasures, but do expect value-for-money and a nice memory from Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean large friendly helpful comfortable”
Reviews.Author: thewendyhousen12
Reviews.Content: Enquired about availability two doors away, full, staff telephoned Francesco, family room available, went straight there. Very nice welcome. Clean, comfortable room, good breakfast. Friendly atmosphere. Would definitely recommend to others and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the ResidenzaKi”
Reviews.Author: kinverdave
Reviews.Content: Just thought I`d let everyone know how much we enjoyed our stay at the ResidenzaKI hotel in Rome recently. The landlord Gigi could not have been more helpful, for example when we first arrived he insisted on carrying all our luggage ( family of 5 ) to our rooms, nothing unusual in that you may think, but when I tell you he had 2 suitcases under 1 arm, a large heavy one under the other arm, 2 shoulder bags around his neck and he carried them up 4 flights of stairs! , I for one was well impressed. He then gave us useful information about all the major attractions over complimentary drinks which were most welcome. The air conditioned rooms were nice, spacious and very comfortable. The hotel was well placed in a quiet street being centrally located and if we go back to Rome we will definately stay there again. Cheers Dave Kelly and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: LondonKevinM
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from 6 nights at the Residenza Ki. We found it to be a hotel that suited our needs entirely. As other reviewers have indicated there is not much of a front to the hotel. It is simply a door into a block of apartments. We arrived late but were met at the door, greeted by name and made welcome. Throughout the stay Francesco was friendly and helpful, without being too pushy. The rooms are simple, but they are clean and comfortable. Breakfast was what we expected rolls, cereal, croissants etc. It was fresh and tasty. The best feature of the Residenza is definitely its location. From the Hotel we managed to walk to everywhere we wanted to get to in about 30 minutes. The Vatican, Coliseum and Bioparc are all with 30 minutes walk. The Trevi fountain is about 2 minutes away with the Spanish steps about 4. There are so many restaurants with 2 or 3 minutes we tried several different ones each day and were never disappointed with any of them. The Termini station would have been a bit too far to walk carrying luggage so getting a Taxi was a good idea. The Hotel is not a luxury accommodation with everything provided in house, but then it does not charge for these features we did not want. For us it was a clean, warm and friendly hotel in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: memoo
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location, only 2 minutes walk to the trevi and less than 5 mins away from the spanish steps. All major tourist attractions are definitely within walking distance. The room we stayed in was on the first level, which was a basic room. Had problems with the hot water (no hot water for the 3 out of 4 days we stayed there, but eventually fixed). Floors were dirty and had not been cleaned. Small room, with small bathroom. Good aircon. Breakfast was very basic. If you are arriving late I would highly recommend aiport pickup as we had to check in at another hotel and were then driven to Risendza Ki. I am not sure if we would stay here again. We found a great restaurant nearby called That's amore which served great pasta and meat dishes. Went back there a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Five enjoyable nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: J_DNorthumberland
Reviews.Content: A taxi, organised by the hotel collected us from the airport, as we were late arriving, this took us to register in sister hotel and then to the Residenza Ki, otherwise it would have been difficult to find. Overall it is clean, quiet, with functioning air-con. The staff were attentive and helpful, especially Gigi, with smiles and coffee. This is an excellent base to explore, central to the Trevi and Spanish Steps, close enough to walk to all the major sites. We stayed five nights and looked forward to returning to the room after a morning sight-seeing for a cool siesta, and then off to dinner. The atmosphere was relaxed but attentive. We slept well, unusually for us when on holiday, in comfortable beds and with the the optional hum of the air-con the only distracting noise. This is not a hotel in the sense of sitting areas and a bar, but it is a small and friendly pension which is welcoming and with rooms I looked forward to returning to after a hot days walking. Overall I felt good value for money, and I recommend it for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always helpful”
Reviews.Author: Trific
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the middle of the main tourist attractions. The level of customer service from Gigi (the concierge) was exceptional. He was always courteous and especially helpful with advice on the best places to see. We really appreciated the coffee he offered upon our arrival and every day after we had walked around the city in temperatutes of 35C. The only reservation concerning the accommodation was the condition of the shower which frankly had seen better days and was in dire need of a complete re-furbishment. If you want a good restaurant nearby, try the Colline Emiliane in Via degli Avignonesi (parallel to via Rasella where the Resedenza Ki is situated). Good food and service, £22 a head for 3 courses and wine).

Reviews.Title: “Handy, but some reservations”
Reviews.Author: SAZANDPAUL
