Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 1pm, and there was no easy identifiable signs. The only way we found out was the nice guy outside who appeared to camp out there 24/7! He and Gigi(manager) both helped with our luggage up the 2 flights of stairs. The first room we stayed in for one night was basic, dirty and and a dull room, and kept in a poor state of repair (the toliet seat was not attached properly, walls had numerous scrape marks, shower walls and shower curtain were dirty, pillows and bed spread/cover were also in need of a proper wash.) Gigi agreed to move us to the second floor, for our remaining stay. Our second room was not perfect but an improvement. The safe didn't work, nor did the fridge again the showers walls and curtain were dirty and the bed spread and pillows in need of a wash. On the plus side the air conditioning was a god send and worked well. Gigi was polite and helpful, breakfast was nice, basic but plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: dindio
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Residenza Ki. We booked two rooms, one for two teenagers and another for my husband and I. The rooms opened out into the dining room, which we felt was convenient when we just wanted to eat before showering and getting ready for the day. Gigi was so helpful and showed us on a map how to get to where we wanted to go in Rome. The breakfast was very simple, but very good. We enjoy the typical European continental breakfasts. Gigi made the most delicious coffee and it felt very homey. The location was excellent, as it was very convenient to walk everywhere. We did have to carry our bags up the flight of stairs, however, Gigi came down and was more than happy to help us with them. It was like staying in a little private home. The teenagers had a triple, which was very roomy, and our room was a double which was smaller. We didn't mind. The experience of staying there was nice. Thanks for a nice stay Gigi. Mike and Phyllis, California

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Welshie21
Reviews.Content: Our requirement was for somewhere conveniently located, clean, reasonably priced and where we could just crash. We were visiting Rome for 2 days and wanted to pack in as much as possible, so time was crucial. Despite a check in time of 2pm, we arrived at 8.30am and were offered coffee and breakfast whilst the room was checked. We were able to leave our bags in our room. GG the hotel manager was helpful in showing us how to get to sites and advised us of some that didn't appear obvious in the guide books. The next day we were able to leave our bags in the room and check out later in the day. When we returned at 6.30pm we were again offered drinks whilst GG ordered a taxi. He told us the mamimum we should be paying. He waited with us until the taxi arrived and informed the driver we were aware of the max price. GG was friendly, curteous and nothing was too much trouble. Remember this is a 3* not a 5*. There is no sign outside the hotel so you need to look for the number. Previous reviewers had said it was hard to find. As we were aware of this we had no trouble in finding the hotel as we were not looking for an obvious building or sign. Jacqueline, Lynn and Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Bad place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: EChy
Reviews.Content: Not a nice hotel. It is not even a hotel, it is more like a bed and breakfast. You pay a lot more for what you get. The rooms are not nice, nor clean. The staff was not helpful at all. The only good thing was that it had a good location, but other than that for that same price you can get a much better hotel in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: KenfromNY
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on feedback on TripAdvisor. I am still wondering how people gave it positive reviews (or how it has a 3 star rating). It was unquestionably the low point of our two week vacation in Europe. First, let me say that the front desk staff tried to be helpful while they were there (8 am to early evening each day). But so did the crew on the Titanic. When we checked in (we had two rooms), I was told that I had to pay for everything up front. That alone should have been a warning. Unfortunately, I ignored it. The rest is a blotch on a great family experience in Rome. My wife and I stayed in Room 5. The sleeping area of the room was dirty (and trust me, I'm not being picky). I opened the doors to the armoire, sent some dust flying, and quickly closed them. The shower stall was rusty, the shower was curtain ripped, there was dirt hanging down from the bathroom ceiling fan, and there was serious black mold growing on the bathroom walls. If asked for a one word description, I would have to pick DISGUSTING. I immediately asked for another room, and was told they were all booked. In retrospect, I should have just taken our luggage and left. There were continual problems with hot water. Of the five nights we were there, we showered in cold water three times. And when the hot water went out after 6 pm, there was no one there to "fix" it until the next day, as there is no staff on site in the evening. We even tried to call the emergency number one evening, but it was just the front desk number! My kids had problems with the air conditioning in their room. They too showered in cold water. And their room didn't even have a phone. The general areas have marks on the walls, and are in serious need of painting and a new floor. There are wires hanging from the ceiling in the reception area. On this trip, we stayed at b&b's in Paris, Florence, and Rome. The others were fine; this one was terrible. Our suggestion is - find any other place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Different”
Reviews.Author: mirlag
Reviews.Content: Residenza Ki was a new kind of experience for me. It is on the 3rd floor of an apartment building with no elevator. It is laid out with the reception desk facing the entry into the residence. To the right is a small eating area with 4 tables where breakfast is served. Three bedrooms are right off of this area and a few more bedrooms are off to the left of the reception desk. When we stayed at Residenza Ki, Diego was the whole enterprise, with the exception of a maid. Diego is a very nice young man whose English is excellent. He made excellent recommendations for restaurants. He was always pleasant and friendly. Residenza Ki is in an excellent location----a short walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The location and price were two of this "hotel's" strong selling points. The third selling point was that reviewers on this site rated it high for cleanliness, which it was. The first room we stayed in was small and the bathroom tiny. The second room we got, upon our return from Florence, was a triple and a nice size---a definite improvement on the first room. However, both rooms are somewhat austere. The breakfasts were fine. One night and for most of the next morning there was no hot water. When we arrived, Diego said that their computer system was down so that we would not have internet access. He said that he was hoping it would be fixed soon. My husband, an electronics and computer expert, checked around in the evening and easily hooked easily hooked us up to their system, which was not really broken. We were able to use our computer during our entire stay. Interestingly enough, the last morning of our stay, a Brit, who had recently arrived, asked about internet access. Again Diego said that the system was down, which was not true since we had just hooked up a few minutes earlier. Would I stay there again? Not sure. If I did, price would be the only lure. By American standards I would rate Residenza Ki as a two star.

Reviews.Title: “great!!”
Reviews.Author: shane-murray
Reviews.Content: great stay, nice little quaint hotel at a reasonable price. we left a bad hotel and booked this with an hours notice. the receptionist couldnt do enough for us and he was helpful in any way possible. beds comfortable and spacious room. great overall!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Central”
Reviews.Author: Lindy61
Reviews.Content: Simple but very well done. Our room was spotlessly clean. We had a large room, 203 on the same floor as reception. It had a tiled area with a dressing table and 2 easy chairs then a step down to a double bed this area had a wooden floor. we had a small en suite bathroom with shower. We sometimes found it hard to regulate the water temperature, but there was always pleny of hot water. The temperature in the room was perfect. Breakfast was delicious, continental with pastries, rolls, meat, eggs and cheese. There was fresh fruit and cereal as well. The coffee was fresh and made just as we ordered. This hotel was in a really central location. We walked to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Pantheon. It is a five minute walk from Baberini Square with it's Metro Station and open top bus stop, these put you within easy reach of St Peter's and the Colloseum. However the hotel's situation on a small side street meant it was very quiet. We ate well but especially enjoyed Pepys Bar on Baberini Sq for lovely sandwiches, cakes and coffee to die for, and also Valentines Gelataria on the road to the Trevi Fountain from the Hotel. But I have left the best until last this hotel is 5 star because of it's excellent staff, from the minute we arrived early and dripping wet to the moment we left 4 days later after a late check out, we were treated like royalty. Nothing was too much trouble we were welcomed with coffee, talked through restaurants and given directions for sites. On our reservation I had put a request for foam pillows and this had been noted and was one of the first things Gigi spoke to me about, I always make this request and usually have to ask again once I've checked in, this level of service makes customers feel very special. Firstly Gigi and then when he went on leave Francesco looked after us very well. We would certainly recommend this hotel to our friends and would go back ourselves in a heartbeat. If you want a really Italian experience you can't go wrong. BTW our bed was also a little lumpy and a bit creaky but we slept soundly and woke without backpain on all 3 nights which is unusual for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NOR_OZ
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed three nights at the Residenza Ki at the beginning of February, and we were very pleased with the stay. The staff is very friendly and serviceminded, and at a arrival Gigi welcomed us with a cup of coffee and sat down with us to show us the map of Rome, pointing out what we should see and how we could get there. The room was clean, had nice timber floors and a tiled bathroom. We had no problems with the shower. Breakfast was simple but nice (filled croissants, breadrolls, ham, cheese, juices, cereal, milk and fruit) and we appreciated the coffee - real espresso - made from freshly ground coffeebeans. We did all sightseeing by foot, and the hotel is very close to many main attractions, and shopping on Via Del Corso is also just a stroll away. We would stay here again and can recommend this to anyone on a budget wanting value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicktaylor25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, just a couple of minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. We spent 5 days in Rome and did not get any public transport but managed to see all the sites on foot. The hotel is very small, but is run by a very helpful and welcoming man (Gi Gi). He provides a map upon arrival and circled all the main attractions. The room was nice, with a good and fully functioning bathroom (good shower). I would say that the bed could have been better as it was pretty uncomfortable and very squeeky. Other than that, no complaints. The breakfast is simple but very nice - cereal, fruit, toast and great coffee. I would reccommend this hotel for a short break, if a budget hotel is what your looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BabyTBristol
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. The room was quite small, but I guess that's what you get for a reasonable price in the centre of rome. The shower took ages to warm up and didn't drain well so the bathroom floor got flooded. There is a fridge in the room which was handy but it was noisy so I had to unplug it during the night in order to sleep. The location was great though, we manged to walk everywhere we wanted to go and as it was such a good location that we didn't spend much time in the hotel anyway. I would recommend this hotel as good value for money, but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “But we booked to stay at Residenza Ki!”
Reviews.Author: MopheadSydney
Reviews.Content: We made a website booking on lastminute.com to stay at Residenza KI from 27 December to 29 December 2006 and paid in advance . The hotel promptly responded to our advance emails about a taxi transfer and we were duly picked up from the airport on arrival. However, when we reached the hotel we were told that we had to spend the night at the sister hotel, Hotel Saturnia (about a 10 minute walk away). This was extremely annoying since the reason we had chosen Residenza Ki was due to its central location. Residenza Ki arranged for the taxi to drop us at the sister hotel where we then spent one night. The next day Residenza Ki moved our bags over to the correct hotel and paid for our return taxi to the airport (45 euros) as compensation. I do not consider it is OK for a hotel to overbook you, particularly when you have paid in full in advance and the hotel knows for sure you are coming because it is sending a taxi to the airport to pick you up. On a better note, the staff at Residenza Ki were very nice, the accommodation basic but clean (unreliable showers) and the location great. Check out the history of Via Rasella if you stay there because it is interesting. We would stay there again if we could have the guarantee that we would be staying there ! The sister hotel is in fact of a slightly higher standard but that's not the point.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jojojinx
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel, easy to find and only a few minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain. The staff are freindly and we were greeted by a cup of coffee and and were given advice on the best way to get around Rome etc. The room itself was clean and although not huge it had everything you would need. The breakfast was fresh every morning, and you can come and go as you please all through the night. We will definately stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “good location hotel not bad”
Reviews.Author: nije
Reviews.Content: We booked after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. The location is very good only 200 meters from the Trevi fountain, and easy reach for Barberini metro stop. Hotel is hard to find and the front door looks just like a private house. The owner is very helpful and explained TV etc. Room was clean but bed was old and uncomfortable. Shower was 'iffy'. He recomended' Al Bochella' restuarant which was quite close and very good. No breakfast on check out day even though information said it was available from 8.00 no one was there.(our room was on a different floor with no access to dining room unless someone unlocked it.) Overall not too bad and fair price, but i have stopped in better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: CDV&HA
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place for a girly (40th birthday weekend) somewhere you didn't need to get a bus or a metro before you started your day, not hilly, not too expensive and near to the Trevi Fountain.it took a long time to find it but we were so glad that we did - well Karen did. I agree with the other reports say the room (we booked a triple) was very spacious, comfy beds, air con - mini-bar etc. tasty breakfast .. We found ourselves at breakfast wondering how it must have been when it was an apartment. A very homely place to stay in. The most fantastic thing was it's location! (5 mins from 2 famous landmarks and the Barberini metro station) We came out of the 'door' crossed the street walked down a bit, round the corner and there it was La Fontana di Trevi. Day or night it was beautiful as were the Spanish Steps.We mixed sight-seeing, shopping (bought a few handbags in the Carpisa shop), eating etcc. and didn't get lost once (our hubbies don't believe us) Went to a concert in a nearby church - mix of opera & classical which was nice. I love to see the t A small guide book and comfy shoes is all you need to see lots of famous landmarks. We took the metro to the Vatican - and went into the castell which was built for Hadrian (a bit of his wall is nearby our home - felt quite important!). Our weather for the 22nd of September was glorious. Even used a bit of sunscreen ?? We did find it a bit of a nuisance having to check in at the sister hotel (our flight came in at 9.30 pm) but we had prebooked a taxi with the hotel from the airport and I made sure it took us to both hotels. What was more of a nuisance was having to take our luggage back to the sister hotel to store it (our flight left at 10pm). However, it did let us see that we had chosen a much nicer, quainter part to have stayed at. Would recommend anyone to stay here. Have friends going out in January - quite jealous actually.

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Ki Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Rasella 53, 00187 Rome, Italy
